2729.caption: Papillary digital eccrine adenocarcinoma. tubular growth pattern with micropapillary projections into ductal lumina.

2730.caption: Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency panniculitis. A, Fat necrosis around the periphery of the lobules. B, Neutrophils dissect through the collagen of the septa and the deep dermis. this process may lead to perforation to the skin surface.

2731.caption: Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency panniculitis. A, Fat necrosis around the periphery of the lobules. B, Neutrophils dissect through the collagen of the septa and the deep dermis. this process may lead to perforation to the skin surface.

2732.caption: porocarcinoma. Carcinoma arising from a preexisting poroma, transition area with atypical carcinoma cells with squamous differentiation adjacent to the bland epithelial cells of the poroma.

2733.caption: porocarcinoma. A, an invasive adenocarcinoma is seen with connection to the epidermis. B, Invasive component with cribriform growth pattern. C, an intraepidermal component is also present.

2734.caption: porocarcinoma. A, an invasive adenocarcinoma is seen with connection to the epidermis. B, Invasive component with cribriform growth pattern. C, an intraepidermal component is also present.

2735.caption: porocarcinoma. A, an invasive adenocarcinoma is seen with connection to the epidermis. B, Invasive component with cribriform growth pattern. C, an intraepidermal component is also present.

2736.caption: pseudocyst of the auricle. A pseudocyst forms as a cystic cavity without an epithelial lining within the auricular cartilage. Note the lack of inflammation around the cartilage.

2737.caption: Pemphigus foliaceus. Neutrophils in the granular cell layer.

2739.caption: Pseudovascular changes of a melanocytic nevus. artifactual clefts are lined by melanocytes.

2740.caption: Intraepidermal blister. Acantholytic subcorneal blister with split underneath the granular cell layer.

2741.caption: Spongiotic blister. Edema separates keratinocytes, many of which are still connected to each other via intercellular bridges.

2742.caption: Intraepidermal blister. Acute spongiotic dermatitis with multiple fluidfilled spaces within the epidermis.

2743.caption: Acantholytic blister. Loss of cell adhesion between keratinocytes has led to a change in their cell shape from polygonal to round or oval. Intercellular bridges are lost.

2744.caption: Melanoma arising in association with a nevus. There is a clear distinction between the cytology of the melanoma and nevus cells.

2745.caption: Melanoma metastatic to skin. A, melanoma nodule in dermis/subcutis. B, Small superficial dermal melanoma nodule with collarette. c, metastatic melanoma simulating blue nevus. d, the blue nevus ike melanoma metastasis contains atypical epithelioid melanocytes.

2746.caption: Melanoma metastatic to skin. A, melanoma nodule in dermis/subcutis. B, Small superficial dermal melanoma nodule with collarette. c, metastatic melanoma simulating blue nevus. d, the blue nevus ike melanoma metastasis contains atypical epithelioid melanocytes.

2747.caption: Melanoma metastatic to skin. A, melanoma nodule in dermis/subcutis. B, Small superficial dermal melanoma nodule with collarette. c, metastatic melanoma simulating blue nevus. d, the blue nevus ike melanoma metastasis contains atypical epithelioid melanocytes.

2748.caption: Melanoma metastatic to skin. A, melanoma nodule in dermis/subcutis. B, Small superficial dermal melanoma nodule with collarette. c, metastatic melanoma simulating blue nevus. d, the blue nevus ike melanoma metastasis contains atypical epithelioid melanocytes.

2749.caption: Silhouette of an ordinary melanocytic nevus. A, Symmetric silhouette of an ordinary polypoid melanocytic nevus. B, Symmetric silhouette of an ordinary plaquelike melanocytic nevus.

2750.caption: Silhouette of an ordinary melanocytic nevus. A, Symmetric silhouette of an ordinary polypoid melanocytic nevus. B, Symmetric silhouette of an ordinary plaquelike melanocytic nevus.

2751.caption: apocrine hidrocystoma. a, apocrine hidrocystoma of the eyelid forms a unilocular cyst in the dermis. b, the diagnostic feature of this cyst is an inner layer of eosinophilic, columnar cells with apical snouts (decapitation secretion).

2752.caption: apocrine hidrocystoma. a, apocrine hidrocystoma of the eyelid forms a unilocular cyst in the dermis. b, the diagnostic feature of this cyst is an inner layer of eosinophilic, columnar cells with apical snouts (decapitation secretion).

2753.caption: apocrine cystadenoma. An apocrine cystadenoma is a multilocular apocrine lesion with some solid areas of proliferative epithelium. In this example papillary infoldings of epithelium are present in some areas.

2754.caption: 9-19 Dermoid cyst. Dermoid cysts have a lining like an epidermoid cyst but have mature, small pilosebaceous units in their cyst walls.

2755.caption: hypertrophic lupus erythematosus. There is a superficial squamous proliferation associated with an inflamed (lichenoid pattern) epidermis that shows variable thickness and keratin plugs.

2756.caption: invasive squamous cell carcinoma. There is an irregular scalloped contour of squamous tongues with epithelial atypia and abrupt maturation, projecting into dermal stroma

2757.caption: The mononuclear langerhans cells in the dermis and epidermis are immunopositive for CD1a.

2758.caption: Widespread noninflammatory small vessel thrombi characterize coagulation disorders such as Coumadin necrosis, disseminated intravascular coagulation, and purpura fulminans.

2759.caption: Nonvasculitic inflammatory purpura; extravasation of red blood cells without evidence of vasculitis.

2760.caption: Blister associated with staphylococcal sepsis. Clusters of cocci (septic emboli) are present within blood vessels. the skin surface is ulcerated (necrotic epidermis is sloughed off).

2761.caption: Blister associated with staphylococcal sepsis. Clusters of cocci (septic emboli) are present within blood vessels. the skin surface is ulcerated (necrotic epidermis is sloughed off).

2762.caption: Blister associated with staphylococcal sepsis. Clusters of cocci (septic emboli) are present within blood vessels. the skin surface is ulcerated (necrotic epidermis is sloughed off).

2763.caption: Melanoma arising in association with a blue nevus. A, large nodules of melanocytes are present with focal necrosis and melanosis. B, the nodules are present in a background of blue nevus. a transition from ordinary to cellular blue nevus and melanoma with necrosis is seen.

2764.caption: Melanoma arising in association with a blue nevus. A, large nodules of melanocytes are present with focal necrosis and melanosis. B, the nodules are present in a background of blue nevus. a transition from ordinary to cellular blue nevus and melanoma with necrosis is seen.

2765.caption: pancreatic enzyme fat necrosis. granular bluish material is characteristic (because of saponification of fat and subsequent localized deposition of calcium). Neutrophils are also often present.

2766.caption: Bullous pemphigoid. a, Subepidermal blister. B, the blister cavity contains eosinophils.

2767.caption: Bullous pemphigoid. a, Subepidermal blister. B, the blister cavity contains eosinophils.

2769.caption: Fibrous hamartoma of infancy. Four components. 1) Fascicles of fibroblasts; 2) undifferentiated mesenchymal cells in myxoid stroma; 3) mature adipose tissue, and 4) strips of fibroconnective tissue.

2770.caption: Fibromatosis. Long, sweeping fascicles of bland fibroblasts are present.

2771.caption: actinic keratosis. Basilar atypia of keratinocytes, parakeratosis, and solar elastosis are characteristic. In early lesions, adnexal structures lack epithelial atypia and parakeratosis.

2772.caption: Spindle cell melanoma.Nondesmoplastic spindle cell melanoma. the tumor is composed of atypical fusiform melanocytes without any significant intratumoral fibrosis.

2773.caption: Clear cell BCC. most of this BCC shows a clear glycogenated cytoplasm.

2774.caption: BCC with matrical differentiation. a nodular BCC shows a focus of shadow cells (arrow).

2775.caption: BCC with pleomorphic features. this BCC contains tumor cells showing a greater degree of nuclear pleomorphism than usual.

2776.caption: BCC engulfing an eccrine duct. BCCs may contain ductal structures. Usually, as in this case, they are engulfed by the tumor, but occasionally the tumor may show ductal differentiation.

2777.caption: Acute generalized exanthematous pustulosis. Aggregates of neutrophils are present in the stratum corneum.

2778.caption: chronic cutaneous lupus erythematosus. Interface dermatitis with periadnexal lymphocytic infiltrate associated with follicular plugging.

2779.caption: infundibulocystic BCC. a small nodule of cytologically bland basaloid cells is present with small keratocysts.

2780.caption: BCC with squamous differentiation (metatypical BCC). parts of the tumor cell population have a pinker cytoplasm and are keratinizing.

2781.caption: BCC with adenoidal features. Within the tumor nodule, a cribriform architecture is apparent.

2782.caption: Pigmented BCC. melanin pigment is present in tumor cells as well as in macrophages.

2783.caption: Cylindroma. A, Dermal and subcutaneous nodules of basaloid cells. B, the tumor cells are bland, engulf cylinders of hyaline material and are also surrounded by a hyaline membrane.

2784.caption: Cylindroma. A, Dermal and subcutaneous nodules of basaloid cells. B, the tumor cells are bland, engulf cylinders of hyaline material and are also surrounded by a hyaline membrane.

2785.caption: Linear IgA bullous dermatosis. a, Subepidermal blister. B, there are many neutrophils and eosinophils.

2786.caption: Linear IgA bullous dermatosis. a, Subepidermal blister. B, there are many neutrophils and eosinophils.

2787.caption: Adenoid cystic carcinoma. A, Silhouette of infiltrative basaloid tumor in dermis and superficial subcutis. B, Cribriform and tubular growth pattern with mucinous cylinders and focal pink hyaline material. C, a subpopulation of tumor cells is positive for CK7. D, a subpopulation of tumor cells is positive for ema.

2788.caption: Adenoid cystic carcinoma. A, Silhouette of infiltrative basaloid tumor in dermis and superficial subcutis. B, Cribriform and tubular growth pattern with mucinous cylinders and focal pink hyaline material. C, a subpopulation of tumor cells is positive for CK7. D, a subpopulation of tumor cells is positive for ema.

2789.caption: Adenoid cystic carcinoma. A, Silhouette of infiltrative basaloid tumor in dermis and superficial subcutis. B, Cribriform and tubular growth pattern with mucinous cylinders and focal pink hyaline material. C, a subpopulation of tumor cells is positive for CK7. D, a subpopulation of tumor cells is positive for ema.

2790.caption: Adenoid cystic carcinoma. A, Silhouette of infiltrative basaloid tumor in dermis and superficial subcutis. B, Cribriform and tubular growth pattern with mucinous cylinders and focal pink hyaline material. C, a subpopulation of tumor cells is positive for CK7. D, a subpopulation of tumor cells is positive for ema.

2791.caption: Sclerotic fibroma: Bland spindled cells are seen in a swirling wood grainlike collagenous stroma.

2792.caption: angiofibroma (fibrous papule): Spindle and stellated cells are present in a collagenous stroma with ectatic, thin-walled blood vessels.

2793.caption: secondary milium. Milia may result from scarring processes, as in this example of a milium developing at a previous biopsy site.

2794.caption: Dariers disease. Corps grains: Pyknotic keratinocytes in stratum corneum with elongated dark nucleus and shrunken eosinophilic cytoplasm.

2795.caption: Sclerosing Spitzs nevus. A, Wedge-shaped intradermal melanocytic nevus. B, plump spindle and epithelioid cells, some with nuclear atypia, are embedded in fibrotic dermis.

2796.caption: Sclerosing Spitzs nevus. A, Wedge-shaped intradermal melanocytic nevus. B, plump spindle and epithelioid cells, some with nuclear atypia, are embedded in fibrotic dermis.

2797.caption: Pigmented Spitz’s nevus. B, histologically, it is composed of many nests of melanocytes at the dermal-epidermal junction surrounded by clefts, and associated with epidermal hyperplasia and hyperpigmentation. c, the nests are composed of slender pigmented fusiform melanocytes.

2798.caption: Pigmented Spitz’s nevus. B, histologically, it is composed of many nests of melanocytes at the dermal-epidermal junction surrounded by clefts, and associated with epidermal hyperplasia and hyperpigmentation. c, the nests are composed of slender pigmented fusiform melanocytes.

2799.caption: Spitzs nevus. Fascicles of fusiform melanocytes are present in association with elongated rete ridges.

2800.caption: Epidermolysis bullosa acquisita. Noninflamed subepidermal blister.

2801.caption: myofibroma. Myoid nodules and plump spindle cells with ecstatic vascular spaces.

2802.caption: Foreign body giant cell reaction to suture.

2805.caption: a, Keratoacanthoma. a crateriform squamous proliferation is present with extensive hyperkeratosis. B, Keratoacanthoma associated with inflammation.

2806.caption: a, Keratoacanthoma. a crateriform squamous proliferation is present with extensive hyperkeratosis. B, Keratoacanthoma associated with inflammation.

2807.caption: squamous cell carcinoma. Scanning magnification reveals a keratinizing tumor with an infiltrative growth pattern extending into the subcutis.

2808.caption: squamous cell carcinoma. Superficial invasion is recognized by an irregular scalloped outline of squamous protrusions with atypical cells growing downward into the dermis.

2809.caption: Well-differentiated squamous cell carcinoma: Keratinization is predominant.

2810.caption: Pleomorphic liposarcoma. Numerous pleomorphic lipoblasts are present.

2811.caption: lichenoid keratosis. Several pink globules (Civatte bodies) are present at the dermal-epidermal junction and in the papillary dermis.

2812.caption: classic pseudopelade of Brocq. B, Late stage disease showing formation of fibrous tracts and absence of sebaceous glands. C, Transverse section depicts extensive destruction of pilosebaceous units. Interface changes are not noted.

2813.caption: classic pseudopelade of Brocq. B, Late stage disease showing formation of fibrous tracts and absence of sebaceous glands. C, Transverse section depicts extensive destruction of pilosebaceous units. Interface changes are not noted.

2815.caption: syringocystadenoma papilliferum. A, papillary fronds project into a cystic lumen. they are lined by apocrine type epithelial cells. B, plasma cells in the stroma of the papillae are typical.

2816.caption: syringocystadenoma papilliferum. A, papillary fronds project into a cystic lumen. they are lined by apocrine type epithelial cells. B, plasma cells in the stroma of the papillae are typical.

2817.caption: Poroma. A, Broad anastomosing strands of small basaloid epithelial cells connected to the epidermis surround hypervascular papillae. B, poroma with surface irritation. poroma cells are juxtaposed to adjacent epidermal keratinocytes with more abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm. C, Dermal poroma component with hyalinized and hypervascular papillae.

2818.caption: Poroma. A, Broad anastomosing strands of small basaloid epithelial cells connected to the epidermis surround hypervascular papillae. B, poroma with surface irritation. poroma cells are juxtaposed to adjacent epidermal keratinocytes with more abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm. C, Dermal poroma component with hyalinized and hypervascular papillae.

2819.caption: Poroma. A, Broad anastomosing strands of small basaloid epithelial cells connected to the epidermis surround hypervascular papillae. B, poroma with surface irritation. poroma cells are juxtaposed to adjacent epidermal keratinocytes with more abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm. C, Dermal poroma component with hyalinized and hypervascular papillae.

2820.caption: Pigmented poroma. A, Circumscribed lobulated growth pattern of basaloid cells connecting to the epidermis. B, melanin pigment is present in keratinocytes.

2821.caption: Pigmented poroma. A, Circumscribed lobulated growth pattern of basaloid cells connecting to the epidermis. B, melanin pigment is present in keratinocytes.

2822.caption: syringocystadenoma papilliferum. A, papillary fronds project into a cystic lumen. they are lined by apocrine type epithelial cells. B, plasma cells in the stroma of the papillae are typical.

2823.caption: Xanthoma. Nodular aggregate of foamy mononuclear cells. a few lymphocytes are also seen.

2824.caption: sweat gland tumor with neuroendocrine differentiation. Basaloid tumor with nodular and infiltrative growth pattern.

2825.caption: Erythema nodosum. The septa are wide and are fibrotic.

2826.caption: nevus spilus. B, there is a focus of a lentiginous melanocytic proliferation in a background of basal layer hyperpigmentation.

2827.caption: deep penetrating nevus. A, a pigmented melanocytic nevus with a wedge-shaped silhouette is seen. B, pigmented spindle and epithelioid melanocytes are present as well as melanophages.

2828.caption: deep penetrating nevus. A, a pigmented melanocytic nevus with a wedge-shaped silhouette is seen. B, pigmented spindle and epithelioid melanocytes are present as well as melanophages.

2829.caption: A, a compound melanocytic nevus is present, the dermal component of which shows in part features of blue nevus. B, Combined congenital and deep penetrating melanocytic nevus.

2830.caption: A, a compound melanocytic nevus is present, the dermal component of which shows in part features of blue nevus. B, Combined congenital and deep penetrating melanocytic nevus.

2831.caption: Melanocytic nevus with large epithelioid cells. Clusters of large epithelioid melanocytes are present in a background of small epithelioid nevomelanocytes.

2832.caption: recurrent melanocytic nevus. B, histologically a melanocytic nevus is present in association with a dermal scar. c, the junctional melanocytic proliferation shows architectural disorder.

2833.caption: recurrent melanocytic nevus. B, histologically a melanocytic nevus is present in association with a dermal scar. c, the junctional melanocytic proliferation shows architectural disorder.

2834.caption: Cutaneous angiomyolipoma. B, the combination of fascicles of spindle cells with giant epithelioid cells with abundant cytoplasms is typical. (Courtesy of Dr. KJ Busam)

2835.caption: Spitzoid melanoma. A, this melanoma shows a wedge-like silhouette with epidermal hyperplasia. Fascicles of pigmented spindle cells are present. there is focal loss of rete ridges. B, mitotic figures are present in dermal melanocytes. the patient died of metastatic melanoma. the tumor had originally been misdiagnosed as Spitzs nevus.

2836.caption: Spitzoid melanoma. A, this melanoma shows a wedge-like silhouette with epidermal hyperplasia. Fascicles of pigmented spindle cells are present. there is focal loss of rete ridges. B, mitotic figures are present in dermal melanocytes. the patient died of metastatic melanoma. the tumor had originally been misdiagnosed as Spitzs nevus.

2837.caption: nevoid melanoma. A, the silhouette of the lesion is nevoid. there is no apparent intraepidermal melanoma. B, expansile aggregates of atypical epithelioid dermal melanocytes are present with mitotic figures.

2838.caption: nevoid melanoma. A, the silhouette of the lesion is nevoid. there is no apparent intraepidermal melanoma. B, expansile aggregates of atypical epithelioid dermal melanocytes are present with mitotic figures.

2839.caption: Friction blister. Predominantly intraepidermal blister with scattered necrotic keratinocytes.

2840.caption: Burn blister. Subepidermal vesicle with no inflammation.

2841.caption: Juvenile xanthogranuloma. A, Dermal infiltrate of mononuclear cells with eosinophilic or foamy cytoplasm. B, Touton-type giant cells are present.

2842.caption: Juvenile xanthogranuloma. A, Dermal infiltrate of mononuclear cells with eosinophilic or foamy cytoplasm. B, Touton-type giant cells are present.

2843.caption: Juvenile xanthogranuloma. Spindle and epithelioid cells with pink cytoplasm. many eosinophils are present.

2844.caption: sebaceous carcinoma. A, Well-differentiated. Sebocystic features predominate. B, moderately differentiated. Sebocystic features are easily recognized, but no longer predominate. C, poorly differentiated. Sebocystic features are rare. D, poorly differentiated. Spindle cell sarcomatoid features may be present.

2845.caption: sebaceous carcinoma. A, Well-differentiated. Sebocystic features predominate. B, moderately differentiated. Sebocystic features are easily recognized, but no longer predominate. C, poorly differentiated. Sebocystic features are rare. D, poorly differentiated. Spindle cell sarcomatoid features may be present.

2846.caption: sebaceous carcinoma. A, Well-differentiated. Sebocystic features predominate. B, moderately differentiated. Sebocystic features are easily recognized, but no longer predominate. C, poorly differentiated. Sebocystic features are rare. D, poorly differentiated. Spindle cell sarcomatoid features may be present.

2847.caption: sebaceous carcinoma. A, Well-differentiated. Sebocystic features predominate. B, moderately differentiated. Sebocystic features are easily recognized, but no longer predominate. C, poorly differentiated. Sebocystic features are rare. D, poorly differentiated. Spindle cell sarcomatoid features may be present.

2848.caption: sebaceous carcinoma. Squamous metaplasia may be present.

2849.caption: lipodermatosclerosis: B, Ischemic changes include atrophy of the fat and fibrous tissue replacement of the fat lobules. Feathery projections of altered fat at the periphery of fat cells and fat cysts are characteristic. C, patients with diabetic vasculopathy and ischemic changes may have extensive occlusive deposition of glycoproteins in the vessel walls and in the interstitium of the subcutis.

2850.caption: lipodermatosclerosis: B, Ischemic changes include atrophy of the fat and fibrous tissue replacement of the fat lobules. Feathery projections of altered fat at the periphery of fat cells and fat cysts are characteristic. C, patients with diabetic vasculopathy and ischemic changes may have extensive occlusive deposition of glycoproteins in the vessel walls and in the interstitium of the subcutis.

2851.caption: metaplastic synovial cyst. A, Villous projections of fibrous tissue into a cystic cavity are characteristic of metaplastic synovial cysts. B, The surfaces of some villous projections are composed of inflammatory or fibroblastic cells that resemble hyperplastic synovium.

2852.caption: metaplastic synovial cyst. A, Villous projections of fibrous tissue into a cystic cavity are characteristic of metaplastic synovial cysts. B, The surfaces of some villous projections are composed of inflammatory or fibroblastic cells that resemble hyperplastic synovium.

2853.caption: Blue nevus with benign trichoblastic proliferation. A, Fusiform melanocytes fill the dermis and extend into the superficial subcutis. Small foci of basaloid proliferations are identified with dense surrounding stroma. B, the basaloid proliferation shows trichoblastic differentiation.

2854.caption: Blue nevus with benign trichoblastic proliferation. A, Fusiform melanocytes fill the dermis and extend into the superficial subcutis. Small foci of basaloid proliferations are identified with dense surrounding stroma. B, the basaloid proliferation shows trichoblastic differentiation.

2855.caption: cellular blue nevus. A, a densely cellular blue nevus is seen in the dermis with a deep tonguelike bulbous extension. B, Dense aggregates of cytologically bland epithelioid melanocytes are present in a background of typical blue nevus. a rare mitotic figure may be seen.

2856.caption: cellular blue nevus. A, a densely cellular blue nevus is seen in the dermis with a deep tonguelike bulbous extension. B, Dense aggregates of cytologically bland epithelioid melanocytes are present in a background of typical blue nevus. a rare mitotic figure may be seen.

2857.caption: epidermotropic metastatic melanoma to skin. A, melanoma is present in the epidermis and dermis. the greatest horizontal dimension of the dermal component exceeds that of the intraepidermal melanoma. B, lymphatic tumor emboli are present.

2858.caption: epidermotropic metastatic melanoma to skin. A, melanoma is present in the epidermis and dermis. the greatest horizontal dimension of the dermal component exceeds that of the intraepidermal melanoma. B, lymphatic tumor emboli are present.

2859.caption: Hobnail hemangioma (targetoid hemosiderotic hemangioma). B, the endothelial cells lining the vascular spaces are bland, but show a hobnail (plump) appearance.

2860.caption: congenital melanocytic nevus. A, Nevomelanocytes extend into the reticular dermis. B, Involvement of adnexal structures by melanocytes is seen.

2861.caption: congenital melanocytic nevus. A, Nevomelanocytes extend into the reticular dermis. B, Involvement of adnexal structures by melanocytes is seen.

2862.caption: 12-31 Proliferative nodule in a giant congenital nevus. B, histologically, at the site of a nodule, a dense aggregate of melanocytes is seen in the dermis with mitotic figures.

2863.caption: Cellular spindle cell nodule in a giant congenital nevus. A, Compound melanocytic nevus with fusiform melanocytes filling the entire dermis and subcutis. B, a nodular spindle cell proliferation with cystic changes blends with the surrounding dermal neurotized nevus cells.

2864.caption: Cellular spindle cell nodule in a giant congenital nevus. A, Compound melanocytic nevus with fusiform melanocytes filling the entire dermis and subcutis. B, a nodular spindle cell proliferation with cystic changes blends with the surrounding dermal neurotized nevus cells.

2865.caption: Melanoma arising in association with a congenital nevus. B, Superficially, bland nevomelanocytes are present. Underneath is a dermal melanoma composed of atypical epithelioid tumor cells.

2866.caption: omphalomesenteric duct cyst. a, Omphalomesenteric duct polyps have a polypoid configuration from scanning magnification. B, An abrupt transition from the polyp to hyperplastic keratinizing squamous epithelium of adjacent skin is typical. Various types of gastrointestinal epithelium may line the polyp or cyst. C, Gastric. D, Colon

2873.caption: acute telogen effluvium. There is a predominance of terminal anagen hairs.

2874.caption: Alopecia Areata. A, Patchy areas of baldness. B, There is an increase in the proportion of telogen hair (horizontal section). C, Peribulbar lymphocytes are characteristic (horizontal section). D, The lymphocytes do not only swarm around the bulb, but may also infiltrate the bulb (vertical section).

C, Peribulbar lymphocytes are characteristic (horizontal section). D, The lymphocytes do not only swarm around the bulb, but may also infiltrate the bulb (vertical section).

2878.caption: giant cell fibroblastoma. (A) giant cell fibroblastoma is composed of spindled to stellate tumor cells punctuated by multinucleated tumor cells in a myxoid to hyalinized background. (B) the multinucleated cells frequently line pseudovascular spaces.

2879.caption: giant cell fibroblastoma. (A) giant cell fibroblastoma is composed of spindled to stellate tumor cells punctuated by multinucleated tumor cells in a myxoid to hyalinized background. (B) the multinucleated cells frequently line pseudovascular spaces.

2880.caption: hidradenoma papilliferum. the inner epithelial cells show abundant pink cytoplasm and apocrine-type secretion.

2881.caption: Apocrine adenoma. the inner epithelial cells show abundant pink cytoplasm and apocrine-type secretion.

2882.caption: Tricholemmoma. A, a superficial dermal nodule of small cuboidal keratinocytes with a lobular growth pattern is associated with a follicle. B, Clear cell changes are common. Note also the dense pink membrane surrounding the base of the lobular proliferation.

2883.caption: Tricholemmoma. A, a superficial dermal nodule of small cuboidal keratinocytes with a lobular growth pattern is associated with a follicle. B, Clear cell changes are common. Note also the dense pink membrane surrounding the base of the lobular proliferation.

2884.caption: acantholytic actinic keratosis. Clefts are seen between basilar and suprabasilar keratinocytes reflecting towing to acantholysis.

2885.caption: Full-thickness epidermal atypia with loss of normal maturation indicates in situ (intraepidermal) squamous cell carcinoma. this feature was present in a background of an actinic keratosis.

2886.caption: microinvasive squamous cell carcinoma. solated cells and small cell clusters of atypical keratinocytes are seen in the papillary dermis (arrow). This microinvasive SCC arose in association with an acantholytic AK.

2887.caption: Carcinoma ex spiradenoma. a poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma (arrow) is seen adjacent to a spiradenoma (arrow head).

2888.caption: Carcinoma ex cylindroma. a poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma is present (A) adjacent to nodule of cylindroma (B).

2889.caption: Carcinoma ex cylindroma. a poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma is present (A) adjacent to nodule of cylindroma (B).

2890.caption: mucocele. a, a fluid-filled cyst underlying oral mucosa is typical of a mucocele. Note the minor salivary gland beneath the cyst, indicating that this cyst arose from the superficial portion of a salivary duct. b, histiocytes with vacuolated cytoplasm (muciphages) result from ingested mucin. Note the absence of an epithelial lining.

2891.caption: mucocele. a, a fluid-filled cyst underlying oral mucosa is typical of a mucocele. Note the minor salivary gland beneath the cyst, indicating that this cyst arose from the superficial portion of a salivary duct. b, histiocytes with vacuolated cytoplasm (muciphages) result from ingested mucin. Note the absence of an epithelial lining.

2895.caption: Melanoma. A, the silhouette of the tumor is asymmetric. B, polypoid melanoma.

2896.caption: Mucin. edematous matrix with bluish granules and fibroblasts.

2897.caption: Basomelanocytic tumor. A, melanoma has metastasized to the site of basal cell carcinoma (collision phenomenon). B, an immunostain for gp100 (hmB-45) demonstrates that the basal cell carcinoma has been colonized by melanoma cells simulating the pattern of what has been referred to as basomelanocytic tumor.

2901.caption: Cavernous lymphangioma. The lesion is typically present in the reticular dermis and/or subcutis. It is composed of a complex proliferation of vessels lined by bland endothelial cells. An associated lymphocytic infiltrate is commonly present.

2902.caption: Neutrophilic muscular vessel vasculitis associated with loss of the elastic lamina (elastic tissue stain, top).

2904.caption: Small vessel neutrophilic vasculitis (leukocytoclastic vasculitis) is identified by the presence of fibrin deposits, nuclear debris, and neutrophils disrupting a postcapillary venule.

2905.caption: leiomyosarcoma. Intersecting fascicular pattern of benign smooth muscle tumors but with nuclear hyperchromasia, atypia, and mitotic activity.

2906.caption: traumatic neuroma. Disorganized nerves embedded in a scar.

2907.caption: Microanatomic (clark) levels. A, Clark level I: melanoma is confined to within the epidermis. B, Clark level II: melanoma is present in the epidermis and papillary dermis without filling the papillary dermis. c, Clark level III: melanoma fills and expands the papillary dermis. d, Clark level IV: melanoma extends into the reticular dermis. Coarse reticular dermal collagen bundles surround melanoma cells. e, Clark level V: melanoma extends into subcutaneous adipose tissue.

2922.caption: infantile digital fibromatosis. (A) Infantile digital fibromatosis is composed of fascicles of bland spindle cells that have intracytoplasmic eosinophilic inclusions. the inclusions often have a peri-nuclear location. (B) they can be highlighted by a trichrome stain.

2923.caption: infantile digital fibromatosis. (A) Infantile digital fibromatosis is composed of fascicles of bland spindle cells that have intracytoplasmic eosinophilic inclusions. the inclusions often have a peri-nuclear location. (B) they can be highlighted by a trichrome stain.

2924.caption: elastofibroma. (A) elastofibroma is composed of irregular, eosinophilic elastic fibers that often have beaded or serrated borders. (B) elastic stains highlight the irregularity of the elastic fibers.

2925.caption: elastofibroma. (A) elastofibroma is composed of irregular, eosinophilic elastic fibers that often have beaded or serrated borders. (B) elastic stains highlight the irregularity of the elastic fibers.

2926.caption: verrucous Carcinoma. a, the invasive front is characterized by the presence of broad bulbou tongues of well differentiated squamous epithelium. B, Significant atypia is lacking. Keratinocytes show evidence of maturation and polarity.

2953.caption: Basal cell carcinosarcoma (sarcomatoid BCC) is a biphenotypic tumor with an epithelial component in the appearance of a BCC and an associated malignant spindle cell component with mesenchymal features.
