3072.caption: Maturation of a melanocytic nevus. A, type a melanocytes are large epithelioid cells. B, type B melanocytes are small epithelioid cells with little cytoplasm. C, type C melanocytes are fusiform cells with schwannian features.

3073.caption: metastatic squamous cell carcinoma. a, metastatic poorly differentiated squamous cell carcinoma in dermis with no connection to the epidermis. B, metastatic cystic well differentiated squamous cell carcinoma.

3074.caption: metastatic squamous cell carcinoma. a, metastatic poorly differentiated squamous cell carcinoma in dermis with no connection to the epidermis. B, metastatic cystic well differentiated squamous cell carcinoma.

3075.caption: Vellus hair cyst. a, Vellus hair cysts are located in the dermis. b, the cyst wall is composed of a thin layer of stratified squamous epithelium with an inner granular layer. Note the multiple, small diameter vellus hair shafts and keratin within the cyst cavity.

3076.caption: Vellus hair cyst. a, Vellus hair cysts are located in the dermis. b, the cyst wall is composed of a thin layer of stratified squamous epithelium with an inner granular layer. Note the multiple, small diameter vellus hair shafts and keratin within the cyst cavity.

3077.caption: Epidermolytic hyperkeratosis. Epidermis with granular and vacuolar changes in the upper layers.

3078.caption: neurofibroma. B, random distribution of spindled cells with bland, comma-shaped nuclei embedded in a wiry collagenous background.

3079.caption: syringoma. A, Circumscribed small aggregate of small cysts and epithelial strands in the superficial dermis. B, Characteristic tadpole appearance.

3080.caption: syringoma. A, Circumscribed small aggregate of small cysts and epithelial strands in the superficial dermis. B, Characteristic tadpole appearance.

3081.caption: Staphylococcal scalded skin syndrome. B, the stratum corneum is separated from the epidermis. there is no inflammation.

3082.caption: Pseudoxanthoma elasticum with fragmented elastic fibers.

3083.caption: Minocycline-induced hyperpigmentation. granular, dark-brown or black pigment is present, both free within the dermis and within dermal dendrocytes.

3084.caption: Ductal carcinoma. Invasive adenocarcinoma with cribriform and tubular growth patterns.

3085.caption: apocrine duct carcinoma. the tumor cells show abundant pink cytoplasm.

3086.caption: Condyloma. a, a squamous papilloma is present. B, hpV cytopathic effects are seen in hyperchromatic resinoid nuclei surrounded by a clear space (halo).

3087.caption: Condyloma. a, a squamous papilloma is present. B, hpV cytopathic effects are seen in hyperchromatic resinoid nuclei surrounded by a clear space (halo).

3088.caption: Bullous Sweets syndrome. Subepidermal vesicular dermatitis with marked dermal edema and numerous neutrophils.

3089.caption: Follicular hybrid cyst. A, This follicular hybrid cyst shows abrupt transition from epidermoid/infundibular (left) to trichilemmal/isthmus (right) differentiation. B, Abrupt transition between epidermoid (left) and matrical (right) differentiation is seen in this cyst from an individual with Gardner’s syndrome.

3090.caption: Follicular hybrid cyst. A, This follicular hybrid cyst shows abrupt transition from epidermoid/infundibular (left) to trichilemmal/isthmus (right) differentiation. B, Abrupt transition between epidermoid (left) and matrical (right) differentiation is seen in this cyst from an individual with Gardner’s syndrome.

3091.caption: steatocystoma. a, Steatocystomas are dermal-based cysts with a thin cyst wall that often contains sebaceous glands. b, the hallmark of this cyst is the undulating, compact, eosinophilic inner layer corresponding to the cuticle of the sebaceous duct.

3092.caption: steatocystoma. a, Steatocystomas are dermal-based cysts with a thin cyst wall that often contains sebaceous glands. b, the hallmark of this cyst is the undulating, compact, eosinophilic inner layer corresponding to the cuticle of the sebaceous duct.

3093.caption: Proliferating trichilemmal cyst/tumor. A, The periphery of a proliferating trichilemmal cyst is defined by circumscribed lobules of squamous cells with a pushing, noninfiltrative border. B, Evidence of a trichilemmal cyst can usually be found at least focally. C, Compact cellular lobules of squamous cells and scattered squamous eddies (arrow) comprise a variable portion of the lesions. D, Occasional mitotic figures (arrow) can be observed in the more proliferative zones of the lesion.

3094.caption: Proliferating trichilemmal cyst/tumor. A, The periphery of a proliferating trichilemmal cyst is defined by circumscribed lobules of squamous cells with a pushing, noninfiltrative border. B, Evidence of a trichilemmal cyst can usually be found at least focally. C, Compact cellular lobules of squamous cells and scattered squamous eddies (arrow) comprise a variable portion of the lesions. D, Occasional mitotic figures (arrow) can be observed in the more proliferative zones of the lesion.

3095.caption: Proliferating trichilemmal cyst/tumor. A, The periphery of a proliferating trichilemmal cyst is defined by circumscribed lobules of squamous cells with a pushing, noninfiltrative border. B, Evidence of a trichilemmal cyst can usually be found at least focally. C, Compact cellular lobules of squamous cells and scattered squamous eddies (arrow) comprise a variable portion of the lesions. D, Occasional mitotic figures (arrow) can be observed in the more proliferative zones of the lesion.

3096.caption: Proliferating trichilemmal cyst/tumor. A, The periphery of a proliferating trichilemmal cyst is defined by circumscribed lobules of squamous cells with a pushing, noninfiltrative border. B, Evidence of a trichilemmal cyst can usually be found at least focally. C, Compact cellular lobules of squamous cells and scattered squamous eddies (arrow) comprise a variable portion of the lesions. D, Occasional mitotic figures (arrow) can be observed in the more proliferative zones of the lesion.

3099.caption: sebaceous carcinoma. B, Large sebaceous tumor with nodular silhouette.

3100.caption: lipodermatosclerosis, secondary to vascular stasis. A, almost total replacement of the subcutis by fibrous tissue. hemosiderin pigment is abundant in the dermis. B, hyalinized sclerosis over the fascia. C, hemosiderin pigment in the hyalinized zone.

3101.caption: lipodermatosclerosis, secondary to vascular stasis. A, almost total replacement of the subcutis by fibrous tissue. hemosiderin pigment is abundant in the dermis. B, hyalinized sclerosis over the fascia. C, hemosiderin pigment in the hyalinized zone.

3102.caption: lipodermatosclerosis, secondary to vascular stasis. A, almost total replacement of the subcutis by fibrous tissue. hemosiderin pigment is abundant in the dermis. B, hyalinized sclerosis over the fascia. C, hemosiderin pigment in the hyalinized zone.

3103.caption: traumatic panniculitis: A, acute trauma that caused necrosis of fat cells lead to an intensive macrophage reaction in the subcutis. B, Vacuolated cytoplasm is abundant in the macrophages surrounding the necrotic fat cells, and often is aligned along the surface of the remaining fat.

3104.caption: traumatic panniculitis: A, acute trauma that caused necrosis of fat cells lead to an intensive macrophage reaction in the subcutis. B, Vacuolated cytoplasm is abundant in the macrophages surrounding the necrotic fat cells, and often is aligned along the surface of the remaining fat.

3105.caption: erosive pustular dermatosis. A, Complete destruction of the pilosebaceous units is present in the late stage. B, Naked hair shaft granulomas are also noted in advanced disease.

3106.caption: erosive pustular dermatosis. A, Complete destruction of the pilosebaceous units is present in the late stage. B, Naked hair shaft granulomas are also noted in advanced disease.

3107.caption: Eosinophilic-rich debris forming the degenerated centers of “red” palisaded and neutrophilic granulomatous dermatitis found in papular and nodular lesions of Churg-Strauss patients.

3108.caption: Blood vessel invasion. tumor cells are present in the wall of a blood vessel.

3109.caption: Lymphatic invasion. Clusters of melanoma cells are present in a lymphatic channel.

3110.caption: nerve involvement. a peripheral nerve is invaded and surrounded by fusiform melanoma cells.

3111.caption: Desmoplastic trichoepithelioma. A, a plaquelike growth of thin cords of cytologically bland basaloid cells set in a sclerotic stroma with calcifications is present. B, a papillary mesenchymal body is identified (arrow).

3112.caption: Desmoplastic trichoepithelioma. A, a plaquelike growth of thin cords of cytologically bland basaloid cells set in a sclerotic stroma with calcifications is present. B, a papillary mesenchymal body is identified (arrow).

3113.caption: Desmoplastic trichoepithelioma. A, a plaquelike growth of thin cords of cytologically bland basaloid cells set in a sclerotic stroma with calcifications is present. B, a papillary mesenchymal body is identified (arrow).

3114.caption: Melanocytic nevus in lymph node. A, Classic small nodal nevus with cytologically bland melanocytes in the lymph node capsule. B, Blue nevus involving lymph node capsule.

3115.caption: Melanocytic nevus in lymph node. A, Classic small nodal nevus with cytologically bland melanocytes in the lymph node capsule. B, Blue nevus involving lymph node capsule.

3116.caption: Necrobiotic xanthogranuloma. an infiltrate of mononuclear histiocytes and Touton-type giant cells surrounds areas of necrobiosis with cholesterol clefts.

3117.caption: Nodular growth pattern of Merkel cell carcinoma.

3118.caption: Merkel cell carcinoma with diffuse infiltrative growth pattern.

3119.caption: Merkel cell carcinoma with large cell features.

3120.caption: Merkel cell carcinoma with intermediate cell features

3121.caption: Merkel cell carcinoma with small cell features.

3123.caption: Combined Merkel cell carcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma.

3124.caption: Merkel cell carcinoma with paranuclear dot–ike staining for CK20.

3125.caption: Metastatic merkel cell carcinoma in sentinel lymph node.

3126.caption: Metastatic melanoma: fine needle biopsy cytology. High power micrograph showing large pleomorphic epithelioid cells with prominent nucleoli. Two mitotic figures are present. There is an occasional multinucleated tumor giant cell. No melanin pigment is apparent (Papanicolaou stained smear).

3127.caption: Metastatic melanoma. Fine needle biopsy cytology. Low power micrograph showing large numbers of dissociating pleomorphic epithelioid cells in a lightly blood-stained background (Romarowsky stained smear).

3128.caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of ductal type. Low power micrograph of punch biopsy of skin showing cohesive clusters of pleomorphic epithelioid cells within the dermis.

3129.caption: Metastatic melanoma. Low power micrograph showing a centrally necrotic tumor involving the dermis and subcutis. The uninvolved epidermis is separated from the underlying tumor by a so-called grenz zone of uninvolved dermis.

3130.caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of ductal type. High power micrograph showing tumor within a dermal lymphatic channel.

3131.caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of ductal type. Medium power micrograph showing nests of tumor with focal gland formation.

3132.caption: Metastatic adenocarcinoma from the lung. High power micrograph showing clusters of large pleomorphic epithelioid cells with focal gland formation.

3133.caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of ductal type. Medium power micrograph showing islands of tumor associated with surrounding dense sclerotic dermal collagenous stroma.

3134.caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of lobular type. Low power micrograph showing single files and small clusters of cells. It is not possible to be certain from the morphologic appearance that this tumor is a carcinoma. Appropriate immunostains to exclude other possibilities (e.g., a large cell lymphoma, melanoma, or epithelioid sarcoma) are necessary

3135.caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of lobular type. Medium power micrograph showing single files of large epithelioid cells dissecting between the dermal collagen bundles.

3136.caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of lobular type. Medium power micrograph showing positive staining of tumor cells with the broad spectrum anticytokeratin antibody AE1/AE3.

3137.caption: Metastatic breast carcinoma of lobular type. Medium power micrograph showing positive staining of tumor cells for estrogen receptor.

3138.caption: Metastatic thyroid carcinoma of follicular type. Low power micrograph showing clusters of epithelioid cells with focal follicle formation.

3139.caption: Metastatic thyroid carcinoma of follicular type. High power micrograph showing clusters of epithelioid cells with focal follicle formation and associated colloid.

3140.caption: Metastatic thyroid carcinoma of follicular type. Medium power micrograph showing positive staining of tumor cells for thyroglobulin.

3141.caption: Metastatic thyroid carcinoma of follicular type. High power micrograph showing positive nuclear staining of tumor cells with the antibody TTF-1.

3142.caption: Metastatic renal cell carcinoma of clear cell type. Medium power micrograph showing nests of large cells with clear cytoplasm. The nests are surrounded by thin-walled capillary-type blood vessels.

3143.caption: Metastatic Merkel cell carcinoma. High power micrograph showing tumor composed of sheets of cells with high nuclear to cytoplasmic ratio, granular chromatin, and mostly inconspicuous nucleoli. Frequent mitoses and apoptotic cells are present.

3144.caption: Metastatic Merkel cell carcinoma. High power micrograph showing positive staining of the tumor cells for CK20.

3145.caption: Metastatic melanoma. High power micrograph showing clusters of pleomorphic epithelioid cells within the dermis. In the absence of intracytoplasmic melanin pigment, an appropriate panel of immunostains would be necessary to confirm that the tumor is a melanoma and not a poorly differentiated carcinoma, lymphoma, or sarcoma

3146.caption: Epidermotropic metastatic melanoma mimicking primary melanoma. Medium power micrograph showing epidermal and dermal components to the tumor. The diagnosis cannot be made without clinicopathologic correlation.

3147.caption: large cell acanthoma. he keratinocytes of large cell acanthoma enlarged nuclei compared to adjacent nonlesional keratinocytes. Hyperchromatism is lacking. There is good evidence of maturation. Pigmentation is common.

3148.caption: moderately differentiated sCC. Only parts of the tumor show keratinization.

3149.caption: A, Poorly differentiated epithelioid SCC. Most of the tumor, such as the focus illustrated here, lacks keratinization. If no keratinization is seen whatsoever, one may use the term “undifferentiated” SCC. B, Poorly differentiated spindle cell SCC. C, The spindle cells are immunoreactive for AE1:AE3.

3150.caption: A, Poorly differentiated epithelioid SCC. Most of the tumor, such as the focus illustrated here, lacks keratinization. If no keratinization is seen whatsoever, one may use the term “undifferentiated” SCC. B, Poorly differentiated spindle cell SCC. C, The spindle cells are immunoreactive for AE1:AE3.

3151.caption: A, Poorly differentiated epithelioid SCC. Most of the tumor, such as the focus illustrated here, lacks keratinization. If no keratinization is seen whatsoever, one may use the term “undifferentiated” SCC. B, Poorly differentiated spindle cell SCC. C, The spindle cells are immunoreactive for AE1:AE3.

3152.caption: Angioleiomyoma. Vascular lumens are surrounded by a proliferation of smooth muscle cells.

3153.caption: Palisaded subcutaneous granulomas. A, Granuloma annulare (GA) has replaced much of the fat lobules. B, Alcian blue stain highlights mucin. C, Deep GA may also contain abundant fibrinous material (hence the term pseudorheumatoid nodule).

3154.caption: Palisaded subcutaneous granulomas. A, Granuloma annulare (GA) has replaced much of the fat lobules. B, Alcian blue stain highlights mucin. C, Deep GA may also contain abundant fibrinous material (hence the term pseudorheumatoid nodule).

3155.caption: Palisaded subcutaneous granulomas. A, Granuloma annulare (GA) has replaced much of the fat lobules. B, Alcian blue stain highlights mucin. C, Deep GA may also contain abundant fibrinous material (hence the term pseudorheumatoid nodule).

3156.caption: Subcutaneous sarcoidosis (Darier-Roussy variant). A, Well-circumscribed, discrete granulomas involve the septa and the lobules of the subcutis. B, Lack of necrosis in untreated lesions and a paucity of lymphocytic infiltrate. C, Macrophages and a few lymphocytes with an activated appearance suggested by their elongated shapes.

3157.caption: Subcutaneous sarcoidosis (Darier-Roussy variant). A, Well-circumscribed, discrete granulomas involve the septa and the lobules of the subcutis. B, Lack of necrosis in untreated lesions and a paucity of lymphocytic infiltrate. C, Macrophages and a few lymphocytes with an activated appearance suggested by their elongated shapes.

3158.caption: Subcutaneous sarcoidosis (Darier-Roussy variant). A, Well-circumscribed, discrete granulomas involve the septa and the lobules of the subcutis. B, Lack of necrosis in untreated lesions and a paucity of lymphocytic infiltrate. C, Macrophages and a few lymphocytes with an activated appearance suggested by their elongated shapes.

3159.caption: Mycobacterium tuberculosis, direct infection of the subcutis. A, Septa are widened and the inflammation is around the periphery of the fat lobules. B, Numerous mycobacteria are detected on acid-fast staining of the tissue.

3160.caption: Mycobacterium tuberculosis, direct infection of the subcutis. A, Septa are widened and the inflammation is around the periphery of the fat lobules. B, Numerous mycobacteria are detected on acid-fast staining of the tissue.

3161.caption: median raphe cyst. a, a median raphe cyst is present in the dermis. b, the epithelial lining is pseudostratified columnar. C, apocrine decapitation secretion can be found in some median raphe cysts.

3162.caption: median raphe cyst. a, a median raphe cyst is present in the dermis. b, the epithelial lining is pseudostratified columnar. C, apocrine decapitation secretion can be found in some median raphe cysts.

3163.caption: median raphe cyst. a, a median raphe cyst is present in the dermis. b, the epithelial lining is pseudostratified columnar. C, apocrine decapitation secretion can be found in some median raphe cysts.

3164.caption: neurotropic melanoma. A, Spindle cell melanoma with plexiform growth pattern. B, Several nerve trunks at the periphery of the tumor are involved by melanoma.

3165.caption: neurotropic melanoma. A, Spindle cell melanoma with plexiform growth pattern. B, Several nerve trunks at the periphery of the tumor are involved by melanoma.

3166.caption: Plexiform fibrohistiocytic tumor. (A) plexiform fibrohistiocytic tumor has an infiltrative, plexiform growth pattern composed of discrete nodules of histiocytic cells and fascicles of myofibroblastic cells. (B) the nodules are composed of round to slightly spindled histiocytic cells. the surrounding myofibroblastic proliferation may be reminiscent of fibromatosis.

3167.caption: Plexiform fibrohistiocytic tumor. (A) plexiform fibrohistiocytic tumor has an infiltrative, plexiform growth pattern composed of discrete nodules of histiocytic cells and fascicles of myofibroblastic cells. (B) the nodules are composed of round to slightly spindled histiocytic cells. the surrounding myofibroblastic proliferation may be reminiscent of fibromatosis.

3168.caption: Pemphigus gestationis. a, Subepidermal vesicular dermatitis with dermal edema. B, Neutrophils and eosinophils are present in edematous dermal papillae.

3169.caption: Pemphigus gestationis. a, Subepidermal vesicular dermatitis with dermal edema. B, Neutrophils and eosinophils are present in edematous dermal papillae.

3170.caption: Nutritional deficiency. there is pallor and necrosis of keratinocytes of the upper epidermis with vesicular degeneration.

3171.caption: Epidermolysis bullosa simplex. a, Noninflamed subepidermal blister. B, Pallor of basilar keratinocytes (eraser effect).

3172.caption: Epidermolysis bullosa simplex. a, Noninflamed subepidermal blister. B, Pallor of basilar keratinocytes (eraser effect).

3173.caption: Juvenile xanthogranuloma. The histiocytes are immunopositive for CD68.

3174.caption: Subcutaneous fat necrosis of the newborn. A, The periphery of the fat lobules is most affected, with macrophage infiltration. B, The fat cells have undergone crystallization of the triglycerides in their cytoplasm. Stellate protein precipitates remain to outline the clefts where the triglyceride crystals were present.

3175.caption: Subcutaneous fat necrosis of the newborn. A, The periphery of the fat lobules is most affected, with macrophage infiltration. B, The fat cells have undergone crystallization of the triglycerides in their cytoplasm. Stellate protein precipitates remain to outline the clefts where the triglyceride crystals were present.

3176.caption: lip pit. An invagination of squamous mucosa is observed in a patient with van der Woude’s syndrome.

3177.caption: Pigmented epithelioid melanocytoma. A, Silhouette of a heavily pigmented tumor. B, It is composed of cytologically bland fusiform melanocytes and numerous melanophages.

3178.caption: Pigmented epithelioid melanocytoma. A, Silhouette of a heavily pigmented tumor. B, It is composed of cytologically bland fusiform melanocytes and numerous melanophages.

3179.caption: cellular blue nevus. A, melanocytes in cellular blue nevi may have a pale cytoplasm and multinucleation. B, large lesions may show cystic changes with or without hemorrhage.

3180.caption: cellular blue nevus. A, melanocytes in cellular blue nevi may have a pale cytoplasm and multinucleation. B, large lesions may show cystic changes with or without hemorrhage.

3181.caption: Vitiligo. Sharply demarcated depigmented patches can be seen.

3182.caption: BCC, superficial pattern. aggregates of basaloid tumor cells in the superficial dermis are connected to the epidermis. typically multiple such foci are present, separated from each other by “skip” areas of normal skin (in two-dimensional view).

3183.caption: BCC, nodular pattern. a solid tumor nodule is present in the dermis.

3184.caption: Basal cell carcinoma. A, a nodular/nodulocystic tumor composed of basaloid cells is seen. B, at the periphery of the tumor nodule, basaloid cells form a picket fence or palisading arrangement. a cleft separates tumor from dermal stroma. the cleft is filled with mucinous material.

3185.caption: Basal cell carcinoma. A, a nodular/nodulocystic tumor composed of basaloid cells is seen. B, at the periphery of the tumor nodule, basaloid cells form a picket fence or palisading arrangement. a cleft separates tumor from dermal stroma. the cleft is filled with mucinous material.

3186.caption: Alopecia mucinosa. B,histologically, there is intrafollicular mucin deposition, in this case associated with a polyclonal infiltrate of T-lymphocytes.

3188.caption: ochronosis with yellow-brown discoloration of fibers.

3189.caption: Dermatomyofibroma: myofibroblasts are arranged in ill-defined fascicles parallel to the overlying epidermis.

3191.caption: Acral melanoma in situ. A, acral in situ melanoma with prominent lentiginous pattern: melanocytes are disposed as solitary units along the base of elongated rete ridges. B, acral in situ melanoma with pagetoid pattern. c, Subungual melanoma in situ.

3192.caption: Acral melanoma in situ. A, acral in situ melanoma with prominent lentiginous pattern: melanocytes are disposed as solitary units along the base of elongated rete ridges. B, acral in situ melanoma with pagetoid pattern. c, Subungual melanoma in situ.

3193.caption: extramammary Pagets disease. A, Intraepidermal adenocarcinoma is associated with a solid dermal invasive component. B, lymphatic tumor emboli are seen. C, Intraepithelial adenocarcinoma may extend along sweat ducts.

3194.caption: extramammary Pagets disease. A, Intraepidermal adenocarcinoma is associated with a solid dermal invasive component. B, lymphatic tumor emboli are seen. C, Intraepithelial adenocarcinoma may extend along sweat ducts.

3195.caption: extramammary Pagets disease. A, Intraepidermal adenocarcinoma is associated with a solid dermal invasive component. B, lymphatic tumor emboli are seen. C, Intraepithelial adenocarcinoma may extend along sweat ducts.

3196.caption: Carcinosarcoma. The tumor has an epithelial component with features of squamous cell carcinoma as well as a keratin-negative malignant spindle cell component.

3197.caption: Neovascularization of the adventitia associated with a thrombosed muscular artery lumen caused by cutaneous polyarteritis nodosa.

3198.caption: clear cell sarcoma. Nests and fascicles of melanoma cells are present in deep tendinous tissue.

3199.caption: Dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans. (A) Storiform growth pattern of uniform, slender spindled cells. (B) Ineurofibromailtration into the subcutis resulting in entrapment of individual fat cells is typical.

3200.caption: Dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans. (A) Storiform growth pattern of uniform, slender spindled cells. (B) Ineurofibromailtration into the subcutis resulting in entrapment of individual fat cells is typical.

3201.caption: Dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans. (A) Storiform growth pattern of uniform, slender spindled cells. (B) Ineurofibromailtration into the subcutis resulting in entrapment of individual fat cells is typical.

3202.caption: inverted follicular keratosis. The lesion has a smooth peripheral border and contains bland ­keratinocytes. An associated ectatic follicular infundibulum is seen. Many small keratinizing whorls of keratinocytes (squamous eddies) are seen.

3203.caption: Pigmented seborrheic keratosis. There is an increased amount of melanin pigment within lesional keratinocytes. This lesion shows an acanthotic pattern.

3204.caption: Pigmented seborrheic keratosis with a reticulated pattern.

3205.caption: Pigmented seborrheic keratosis with a clonal, nested pattern.

3206.caption: Proliferative actinic keratosis. Thin extensions of rete ridge–like protrusions with atypical basilar ­keratinocytes are seen.

3207.caption: Pigmented actinic keratosis. Actinic keratosis with an associated increase of melanin pigment deposition in keratinocytes. Sometimes pigmentation may also be related to the presence of melanophages or a melanocytic hyperplasia.

3208.caption: myxofibrosarcoma. B, pleomorphic tumor cells are scattered among the low grade appearing myxoid component of low cell density.

3209.caption: Pleomorphic sarcoma. A, Ulcerated dermal-based tumor that extends into the subcutis.

3210.caption: lichen planopilaris. B, Interfollicular lichenoid dermatitis. C, perifollicular lymphocytic infiltrate.

3211.caption: lichen planopilaris. B, Interfollicular lichenoid dermatitis. C, perifollicular lymphocytic infiltrate.

3212.caption: lupus erythematosus profundus. A, lymphoid aggregates are present in the lobules and along the septa. B, Infiltration by lymphocytes and the deposition of hyaline material between the fat cells. C, the lymphocytes are small and round. Some lymphocytes may cluster around fat cells, but they do not form rings.

3213.caption: lupus erythematosus profundus. A, lymphoid aggregates are present in the lobules and along the septa. B, Infiltration by lymphocytes and the deposition of hyaline material between the fat cells. C, the lymphocytes are small and round. Some lymphocytes may cluster around fat cells, but they do not form rings.

3214.caption: lupus erythematosus profundus. A, lymphoid aggregates are present in the lobules and along the septa. B, Infiltration by lymphocytes and the deposition of hyaline material between the fat cells. C, the lymphocytes are small and round. Some lymphocytes may cluster around fat cells, but they do not form rings.

3215.caption: Ganglion cyst. A, A ganglion cyst contains mucin and has a fibrous wall. B, Myxoid degeneration is often seen in the surrounding fibrous tissue. C, The cyst wall lacks an epithelial lining.

3216.caption: Ganglion cyst. A, A ganglion cyst contains mucin and has a fibrous wall. B, Myxoid degeneration is often seen in the surrounding fibrous tissue. C, The cyst wall lacks an epithelial lining.

3217.caption: Ganglion cyst. A, A ganglion cyst contains mucin and has a fibrous wall. B, Myxoid degeneration is often seen in the surrounding fibrous tissue. C, The cyst wall lacks an epithelial lining.

3218.caption: hyaline amyloid material associated with plasma cells. a, Pink appearance on h&e stain. B, orange color on Congo red stain.

3219.caption: hyaline amyloid material associated with plasma cells. a, Pink appearance on h&e stain. B, orange color on Congo red stain.

3220.caption: Lichen amyloidosis. Small hyaline deposits in papillary dermis.

3221.caption: human papillomavirus related follicular cyst. A, Verrucous cysts are characterized by varying degrees of papillomatosis, acanthosis, and hypergranulosis. Most verrucous cysts have infundibular (epidermoid) keratinization. B, Occasionally verrucous cysts can show trichilemmal keratinization. C, Viropathic changes of human papillomavirus are present in this HPV-infected plantar epidermal cyst.

3222.caption: human papillomavirus related follicular cyst. A, Verrucous cysts are characterized by varying degrees of papillomatosis, acanthosis, and hypergranulosis. Most verrucous cysts have infundibular (epidermoid) keratinization. B, Occasionally verrucous cysts can show trichilemmal keratinization. C, Viropathic changes of human papillomavirus are present in this HPV-infected plantar epidermal cyst.

3223.caption: human papillomavirus related follicular cyst. A, Verrucous cysts are characterized by varying degrees of papillomatosis, acanthosis, and hypergranulosis. Most verrucous cysts have infundibular (epidermoid) keratinization. B, Occasionally verrucous cysts can show trichilemmal keratinization. C, Viropathic changes of human papillomavirus are present in this HPV-infected plantar epidermal cyst.

3224.caption: sacral pit. A shallow invagination of epidermis into the dermis characterizes the sacral pit or dimple arising in the midline of the sacrum.

3225.caption: Lentigo simplex. B, histologically the epidermal rete ridges are slightly elongated, associated with basal layer hyperpigmentation as well as a slight increase in the number of cytologically bland intraepidermal melanocytes.

3226.caption: Dermatofibroma. Circumscribed dermal spindle cell tumor. The epidermis over the dermatofibroma often shows hyperplasia and basilar hyperpigmentation.

3227.caption: Dermal scar. A, there is a proliferation of fibroblasts in the superficial dermis. their fusiform nuclei run parallel to the surface. epidermal rete ridges are effaced. B, Keloidal scars contain broad, glassy collagen fibers.

3228.caption: Dermal scar. A, there is a proliferation of fibroblasts in the superficial dermis. their fusiform nuclei run parallel to the surface. epidermal rete ridges are effaced. B, Keloidal scars contain broad, glassy collagen fibers.

3229.caption: Melanocytic nevus of flexural site. a compound melanocytic nevus is present with many large nests and variation in the size and shape of nests.

3230.caption: inflammatory verrucous epidermal nevus. a, Silhouette of a hyperkeratotic squamous proliferation. B, there is psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia associated with alternating hyperorthokeratosis and parakeratosis, and dermal inflammation.

3231.caption: inflammatory verrucous epidermal nevus. a, Silhouette of a hyperkeratotic squamous proliferation. B, there is psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia associated with alternating hyperorthokeratosis and parakeratosis, and dermal inflammation.

3232.caption: squamous cell carcinoma in situ, bowenoid pattern. Human papillomavirus cytopathic changes are seen in this lesion.

3233.caption: Bowenoid squamous cell carcinoma, arising in an irritated seborrheic keratosis. a, Scanning magnification reveals a broad seborrheic keratosis. at one edge, atypia is apparent. B, a close-up of this focus reveals squamous cell carcinoma.

3234.caption: Bowenoid squamous cell carcinoma, arising in an irritated seborrheic keratosis. a, Scanning magnification reveals a broad seborrheic keratosis. at one edge, atypia is apparent. B, a close-up of this focus reveals squamous cell carcinoma.

3235.caption: Squamous cell carcinoma in situ, bowenoid pattern. A, Scanning magnification shows an intraepidermal squamous proliferation composed of keratinocytes with a higher nuclear to cytoplasmic ratio than the non-neoplastic epidermis giving the carcinoma a darker appearance than the adjacent normal epidermis. There is associated inflammation. B, The basal cell layer shows bland keratinocytes. Atypical keratinocytes populate primarily the spinous cell layer.

3236.caption: Squamous cell carcinoma in situ, bowenoid pattern. A, Scanning magnification shows an intraepidermal squamous proliferation composed of keratinocytes with a higher nuclear to cytoplasmic ratio than the non-neoplastic epidermis giving the carcinoma a darker appearance than the adjacent normal epidermis. There is associated inflammation. B, The basal cell layer shows bland keratinocytes. Atypical keratinocytes populate primarily the spinous cell layer.

3237.caption: Cellular neurothekeoma. Nested arrangement of epithelioid tumor cells with relatively abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm. The stromal background is typically hyalinized but may be myxoid.

3239.caption: Trichilemmal cyst. a, trichilemmal cysts are located in the dermis or subcutis and the cysts are filled from large eosinophilic keratinocytes. C, the outer layer of trichilemmal cysts has a tendency to separate from the remainder of the cyst epithelium.

3240.caption: Trichilemmal cyst. a, trichilemmal cysts are located in the dermis or subcutis and the cysts are filled from large eosinophilic keratinocytes. C, the outer layer of trichilemmal cysts has a tendency to separate from the remainder of the cyst epithelium.

3241.caption: Trichilemmal cyst. a, trichilemmal cysts are located in the dermis or subcutis and the cysts are filled from large eosinophilic keratinocytes. C, the outer layer of trichilemmal cysts has a tendency to separate from the remainder of the cyst epithelium.

3242.caption: neuronevus. A, Silhouette of a compound melanocytic nevus with neurotization of its dermal component. B, Superficially a mixture of nests of small epithelioid melanocytes and diffuse arrangement of fusiform melanocytes with schwannian features is seen. c, only the epithelioid melanocytes are immunoreactive for melan-a. the fusiform melanocytes are negative. d, Neuroid structures are present.

3243.caption: neuronevus. A, Silhouette of a compound melanocytic nevus with neurotization of its dermal component. B, Superficially a mixture of nests of small epithelioid melanocytes and diffuse arrangement of fusiform melanocytes with schwannian features is seen. c, only the epithelioid melanocytes are immunoreactive for melan-a. the fusiform melanocytes are negative. d, Neuroid structures are present.

3244.caption: neuronevus. A, Silhouette of a compound melanocytic nevus with neurotization of its dermal component. B, Superficially a mixture of nests of small epithelioid melanocytes and diffuse arrangement of fusiform melanocytes with schwannian features is seen. c, only the epithelioid melanocytes are immunoreactive for melan-a. the fusiform melanocytes are negative. d, Neuroid structures are present.

3245.caption: neuronevus. A, Silhouette of a compound melanocytic nevus with neurotization of its dermal component. B, Superficially a mixture of nests of small epithelioid melanocytes and diffuse arrangement of fusiform melanocytes with schwannian features is seen. c, only the epithelioid melanocytes are immunoreactive for melan-a. the fusiform melanocytes are negative. d, Neuroid structures are present.

3246.caption: Reticulohistiocytoma. large histiocytes with abundant eosinophilic ground glass cytoplasm.

3247.caption: Destombes-Rosai-Dorfman disease. A, Xanthogranulomatous and lymphoplasma cellular infiltrate with large foamy histiocytes. B, Inflammatory cells are seen within the abundant cytoplasm of the histiocytes. C, The large histiocytes are positive for S100 protein.

3248.caption: Destombes-Rosai-Dorfman disease. A, Xanthogranulomatous and lymphoplasma cellular infiltrate with large foamy histiocytes. B, Inflammatory cells are seen within the abundant cytoplasm of the histiocytes. C, The large histiocytes are positive for S100 protein.

3249.caption: Destombes-Rosai-Dorfman disease. A, Xanthogranulomatous and lymphoplasma cellular infiltrate with large foamy histiocytes. B, Inflammatory cells are seen within the abundant cytoplasm of the histiocytes. C, The large histiocytes are positive for S100 protein.

3250.caption: Xanthoma disseminatum. Infiltrate of mononuclear cells with eosinophilic cytoplasm (indistinguishable from lesions of JXg).

3251.caption: Shoulder phenomenon. the junctional melanocytic proliferation extends beyond the periphery of the dermal melanocytic nevus component.

3252.caption: Stromal changes associated with a dysplastic nevus. there is marked lamellar fibrosis in the superficial dermis.

3253.caption: Junctional Spitz’s nevus. Nests of large plump spindle and epithelioid melanocytes are present with clefts surrounding junctional nests. Dull pink globules (“Kamino” bodies) are also identified.

3254.caption: compound Spitz’s nevus. Fascicles of spindle and epithelioid melanocytes are present in association with epidermal hyperplasia and dull pink globules at the dermal-epidermal junction.

3255.caption: Silicone fluid injection site. A, Cells with multiple vacuoles in the cytoplasm are numerous. the silicone fluid also produces multiple cavities or cystlike spaces that are irregular in outline. B, Immunoreactivity for CD68, a lysosomal marker, labels the cytoplasm of the cells very heavily, showing that they are macrophages rather than lipoblasts.

3256.caption: Silicone fluid injection site. A, Cells with multiple vacuoles in the cytoplasm are numerous. the silicone fluid also produces multiple cavities or cystlike spaces that are irregular in outline. B, Immunoreactivity for CD68, a lysosomal marker, labels the cytoplasm of the cells very heavily, showing that they are macrophages rather than lipoblasts.

3257.caption: simplex type of squamous dysplasia. The lesion is characterized by marked hyperkeratosis and parakeratosis, broad rete ridges, basilar keratinocytic atypia, and abnormal maturation. Associated inflammation is common.

3258.caption: desmoplastic melanoma. A, the tumor has an inflamed scarlike appearance. B, the tumor cells are positive for S-100 protein.

3259.caption: desmoplastic melanoma. A, the tumor has an inflamed scarlike appearance. B, the tumor cells are positive for S-100 protein.

3260.caption: Intracorneal and subepidermal pustules found in a patient with small vessel vasculitis related to bacterial infection.

3261.caption: Clear cell variant of atypical fibroxanthoma. the tumor cells have a clear cytoplasm and pleomorphoc nuclei. (Courtesy of Dr. KJ Busam)

3262.caption: Sentinel lymph node with intracapsular and subcapsular nodal nevomelanocytes. A, Cytologically bland small amelanotic epithelioid melanocytes are present in the capsule of a sentinel lymph node from a woman with breast cancer. Similar melanocytes are also present in the node beneath the capsule. B, another focus of intranodal melanocytes in the same node highlighted by an immunostain for mart-1.

3263.caption: Sentinel lymph node with intracapsular and subcapsular nodal nevomelanocytes. A, Cytologically bland small amelanotic epithelioid melanocytes are present in the capsule of a sentinel lymph node from a woman with breast cancer. Similar melanocytes are also present in the node beneath the capsule. B, another focus of intranodal melanocytes in the same node highlighted by an immunostain for mart-1.

3264.caption: Large nodal melanocytic nevus in fibrous tissue and nodal parenchyma. Incidental large nevus found during an axillary node dissection in a patient with breast carcinoma. A, melanocytes are present in the capsule and extend into the nodal parenchyma. B, the melanocytes are cytologically bland; some are clustered around small vessels in fibrous trabeculae. c, an occasional nest of melanocytes is completely surrounded by lymphocytes.

3265.caption: Large nodal melanocytic nevus in fibrous tissue and nodal parenchyma. Incidental large nevus found during an axillary node dissection in a patient with breast carcinoma. A, melanocytes are present in the capsule and extend into the nodal parenchyma. B, the melanocytes are cytologically bland; some are clustered around small vessels in fibrous trabeculae. c, an occasional nest of melanocytes is completely surrounded by lymphocytes.

3266.caption: Large nodal melanocytic nevus in fibrous tissue and nodal parenchyma. Incidental large nevus found during an axillary node dissection in a patient with breast carcinoma. A, melanocytes are present in the capsule and extend into the nodal parenchyma. B, the melanocytes are cytologically bland; some are clustered around small vessels in fibrous trabeculae. c, an occasional nest of melanocytes is completely surrounded by lymphocytes.

3267.caption: miliaria. Subcorneal pustule involving the ostium of the eccrine duct.

3268.caption: inflamed well-differentiated squamous cell carcinoma. Neutrophilic abscesses are present within the tumor.

3269.caption: Conventional invasive squamous cell carcinoma. The carcinoma shows prominent keratinization. It infiltrates the dermis without a stromal reaction. The overlying epidermis does not show more than basal cell layer atypia.

3270.caption: myxoid dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans. Widely spaced, stellate tumor cells in a myxoid stroma.

3271.caption: Reticular erythematous mucinosis. Interstitial mucin deposition associated with perivascular lymphocytic infiltrate.

3272.caption: Cutaneous myxoid cyst. Dermal nodule of mucin and fibroblasts flanked by epidermis.

3273.caption: Scleredema. Interstitial mucin deposition highlighted by alcian blue stain.

3274.caption: Porokeratosis. A, Scanning magnification shows cornoid lamellae angulated toward the center of the lesion. B, A column of parakeratosis (cornoid lamella) is wedged into the epidermis at an angle. The underlying epidermis shows focal loss of the granular cell layer and dyskeratosis.

3275.caption: Porokeratosis. A, Scanning magnification shows cornoid lamellae angulated toward the center of the lesion. B, A column of parakeratosis (cornoid lamella) is wedged into the epidermis at an angle. The underlying epidermis shows focal loss of the granular cell layer and dyskeratosis.

3276.caption: Pilomatricoma. A, a circumscribed subcutaneous nodule is present. B, the tumor is composed of basaloid cells as well as “shadow” cells.* C, multinucleated giant cells are also common.

3277.caption: Pilomatricoma. A, a circumscribed subcutaneous nodule is present. B, the tumor is composed of basaloid cells as well as “shadow” cells.* C, multinucleated giant cells are also common.

3278.caption: Pilomatricoma. A, a circumscribed subcutaneous nodule is present. B, the tumor is composed of basaloid cells as well as “shadow” cells.* C, multinucleated giant cells are also common.

3279.caption: Porocarcinoma. A, Invasive adenocarcinoma. B, Focal squamous metaplasia is seen. C, lymphatic tumor emboli are present.

3280.caption: Porocarcinoma. A, Invasive adenocarcinoma. B, Focal squamous metaplasia is seen. C, lymphatic tumor emboli are present.

3281.caption: Porocarcinoma. A, Invasive adenocarcinoma. B, Focal squamous metaplasia is seen. C, lymphatic tumor emboli are present.

3282.caption: Herpetic blister. Acantholytic keratinocytes with viral cytopathic changes.

3283.caption: Bullous arthropod bite reaction. a, Subepidermal blister. B, many eosinophils are present.

3284.caption: Bullous arthropod bite reaction. a, Subepidermal blister. B, many eosinophils are present.

3285.caption: Bullous lupus erythematosus. Clusters of neutrophils in the papillary dermis.

3286.caption: sebaceous adenoma. expanded sebaceous lobules in the superficial dermis with an increase in number of basaloid cells.

3287.caption: Fibroma of tendon sheath. Bland myofibroblasts are seen in a densely collagenous stroma.

3288.caption: Proliferative fasciitis. Ganglion-like myofibroblasts are seen.

3289.caption: Biopsy of pyoderma gangrenosum–like lesion showed palisaded and neutrophilic granulomatous dermatitis, “blue granuloma,” in a patient with Wegener’s granulomatosis.

3290.caption: tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes. the invasive front of the melanoma is surrounded and infiltrated by lymphocytes.

3291.caption: Melanoma with satellites, histology. a primary melanoma is seen as well as melanoma nodules in the dermis separate from the main tumor mass.

3292.caption: a, Clear cell acanthoma: there is psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia. lesio epidermis. B, the surface is often eroded. Neutrophils are commonly seen within the lesion.

3293.caption: a, Clear cell acanthoma: there is psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia. lesio epidermis. B, the surface is often eroded. Neutrophils are commonly seen within the lesion.

3294.caption: Arteriovenous hemangioma or cirsoid aneurysm. Circumscribed vascular proliferation composed of a mixture of thin and thick-walled vessels.

3295.caption: Pigmented melanocytic nevus. Melanin pigment is typically more prominent in the superficial portion of a nevus.

3296.caption: Melanocytic nevus with fatty changes. adipocytes are present in association with a dermal melanocytic nevus.

3297.caption: Trichilemmal cyst: secondary microscopic features. a, a foreign body giant cell reaction is elicited to extravasated keratin from a ruptured trichilemmal cyst. b, Calcifications are a frequent finding.

3298.caption: Trichilemmal cyst: secondary microscopic features. a, a foreign body giant cell reaction is elicited to extravasated keratin from a ruptured trichilemmal cyst. b, Calcifications are a frequent finding.

3299.caption: nevus sebaceus. papillomatous epidermal hyperplasia overlying a dermis with altered “hamartomatous” sebaceous glands.

3300.caption: Dermal duct tumor. Dermal nodular and nodulocystic aggregates of epithelial cells with poromatous features are present with no connection to the epidermis.

3301.caption: spiradenoma. A, multinodular growth pattern. B, two cell population: small basaloid cells surrounding larger pale epithelial cells.

3302.caption: spiradenoma. A, multinodular growth pattern. B, two cell population: small basaloid cells surrounding larger pale epithelial cells.

3303.caption: metastatic clear cell renal cell carcinoma in the dermis.

3304.caption: hidradenocarcinoma. Infiltrative adenocarcinoma with clear cell features.

3305.caption: mucinous carcinoma. Bland epithelial islands are seen in pools of mucin.

3306.caption: a, Squamous cell carcinoma with desmoplastic stromal reaction (desmoplastic squamous cell carcinoma). this tumor is associated with prominent fibrosis. Its invasive component is composed of many thin tumor strands. B, When a desmoplastic SCC contains strands of epithelium with small keratocytes, it may simulate the appearance of a microcystic adnexal carcinoma.

3307.caption: a, Squamous cell carcinoma with desmoplastic stromal reaction (desmoplastic squamous cell carcinoma). this tumor is associated with prominent fibrosis. Its invasive component is composed of many thin tumor strands. B, When a desmoplastic SCC contains strands of epithelium with small keratocytes, it may simulate the appearance of a microcystic adnexal carcinoma.

3308.caption: squamous cell carcinoma with single cell infiltrative pattern. a, Solitary units of cytologically atypical cells are seen in the dermis. B, they are immunoreactive for 34BE12.

3309.caption: squamous cell carcinoma with single cell infiltrative pattern. a, Solitary units of cytologically atypical cells are seen in the dermis. B, they are immunoreactive for 34BE12.

3310.caption: Granulomatous muscular vessel vasculitis diagnostic of giant cell arteritis.

3311.caption: digital mucous cyst. a, a digital mucous cyst forms a circumscribed nodule in the superficial dermis on acral skin. b, Mucin is deposited between spindle and stellate cells or in cystic spaces (lower right). C, The periphery of the lesion is well demarcated but an epithelial lining is absent.

3312.caption: digital mucous cyst. a, a digital mucous cyst forms a circumscribed nodule in the superficial dermis on acral skin. b, Mucin is deposited between spindle and stellate cells or in cystic spaces (lower right). C, The periphery of the lesion is well demarcated but an epithelial lining is absent.

3313.caption: digital mucous cyst. a, a digital mucous cyst forms a circumscribed nodule in the superficial dermis on acral skin. b, Mucin is deposited between spindle and stellate cells or in cystic spaces (lower right). C, The periphery of the lesion is well demarcated but an epithelial lining is absent.

3314.caption: eosinophilic panniculitis. there is septal edema with abundant eosinophils.

3315.caption: Linear IgA bullous dermatosis. Subepidermal blister with polymorphonuclear cells.

3316.caption: Linear IgA bullous dermatosis. Urticarial phase with string of neutrophils along the dermoepidermal junction.

3317.caption: Clonal seborrheic keratosis. This variant of an irritated seborrheic keratosis shows a nested or whorled arrangement of intraepidermal keratinocytes.

3318.caption: irritated seborrheic keratosis. Papillomatous and acanthotic growth pattern with spongiosis and inflammation.

3319.caption: a, Irritated seborrheic keratosis: one part of this keratosis grows outward and is inflamed. another component grows inward and shows fusiform keratinocytes. B, Close-up view of the fusiform keratinocytes with small bland nuclei. Such fusiform keratinocytes are not uncommon in irritated seborrheic keratoses.

3320.caption: a, Irritated seborrheic keratosis: one part of this keratosis grows outward and is inflamed. another component grows inward and shows fusiform keratinocytes. B, Close-up view of the fusiform keratinocytes with small bland nuclei. Such fusiform keratinocytes are not uncommon in irritated seborrheic keratoses.

3321.caption: stucco keratosis. Small, sharply pointed papillomatous projections are seen with orthokeratosis and hyperkeratosis.

3322.caption: Digitated seborrheic keratosis shows papillomatous outward projections simulating a verruca.

3323.caption: Pleomorphic fibroma. Scattered hyperchromatic, often multinucleated tumor cells are present in a collagenous background.

3324.caption: hemorrhagic scar with hemosiderin pigment. A, h&e stain shows coarse brownish-yellow granules. B, the granules turn blue with the Prussian blue reaction.

3325.caption: hemorrhagic scar with hemosiderin pigment. A, h&e stain shows coarse brownish-yellow granules. B, the granules turn blue with the Prussian blue reaction.

3328.caption: angiocentric fibrosis and focal small vessel vasculitis found in a cutaneous inflammatory pseudotumor.

3329.caption: in situ melanoma mimicking invasive melanoma. melanoma cells are confined to the epithelial site of the basement membrane within the sweat gland apparatus and a hair follicle.

3330.caption: invasive melanoma. melanocytes in the dermis resemble intraepidermal melanoma cells. the dermal melanocytes lack an orderly nested pattern and diffusely infiltrate the dermis.

3331.caption: lipoblastoma. Fetal-type fat is seen with bland spindle cells, lipoblasts, variably mature adipocytes, and myxoid stroma.

3332.caption: microcystic adnexal carcinoma. Appearance similar to a syringoma, but the tumor infiltrates deep dermis and superficial subcutis.

3333.caption: microcystic adnexal carcinoma. A, Diffuse infiltrative growth pattern. B, Compressed thin cords of basaloid epithelial cells in sclerotic stroma with rare small keratinocytes (sclerosing sweat duct tumor).

3334.caption: microcystic adnexal carcinoma. A, Diffuse infiltrative growth pattern. B, Compressed thin cords of basaloid epithelial cells in sclerotic stroma with rare small keratinocytes (sclerosing sweat duct tumor).

3335.caption: morpheaform BCC. this BCC shows an infiltrative growth pattern. Basaloid cords and strands are set in a densely fibrotic stroma.

3336.caption: BCC, micronodular pattern. the tumor is composed of multiple small nodular aggregates of basaloid cells.

3337.caption: Fibroepithelioma of Pinkus. thin anastomosing cords of basaloid cells are present in association with a fibrous stroma.

3338.caption: BCC, infiltrative pattern. thin cords and oddly shaped aggregates of tumor cells are dispersed in a haphazard infiltrative pattern.

3339.caption: Melanocytic nevus of acral skin. A, a circumscribed pigmented macule is seen near the toenail. B, Silhouette of nevus with predominant nested pattern and sharp lateral demarcation. c, a compound melanocytic nevus with superficial dermal pigmentation is present. a vertical column of melanin pigment is seen in the stratum corneum. d, pagetoid spread of cytologically bland melanocytes may be seen in an acral nevus.

3340.caption: Melanocytic nevus of acral skin. A, a circumscribed pigmented macule is seen near the toenail. B, Silhouette of nevus with predominant nested pattern and sharp lateral demarcation. c, a compound melanocytic nevus with superficial dermal pigmentation is present. a vertical column of melanin pigment is seen in the stratum corneum. d, pagetoid spread of cytologically bland melanocytes may be seen in an acral nevus.

3341.caption: Melanocytic nevus of acral skin. A, a circumscribed pigmented macule is seen near the toenail. B, Silhouette of nevus with predominant nested pattern and sharp lateral demarcation. c, a compound melanocytic nevus with superficial dermal pigmentation is present. a vertical column of melanin pigment is seen in the stratum corneum. d, pagetoid spread of cytologically bland melanocytes may be seen in an acral nevus.

3342.caption: pilonidal sinus. a, the superficial aspect of this pilonidal sinus consists of an epidermal lining extending through dermis into subcutis. b, rupture of a pilonidal sinus is associated with inflammation, scar, and a foreign body giant cell reaction to extravasated hair shafts.

3343.caption: pilonidal sinus. a, the superficial aspect of this pilonidal sinus consists of an epidermal lining extending through dermis into subcutis. b, rupture of a pilonidal sinus is associated with inflammation, scar, and a foreign body giant cell reaction to extravasated hair shafts.

3344.caption: extramammary Pagets disease. The tumor cells are immunopositive with Cam 5.2.

3345.caption: common blue nevus. A, a perifollicular pigmented lesion is present associated with mild dermal fibrosis. B, It is composed of pigmented fusiform and dendritic melanocytes as well as macrophages.

3346.caption: common blue nevus. A, a perifollicular pigmented lesion is present associated with mild dermal fibrosis. B, It is composed of pigmented fusiform and dendritic melanocytes as well as macrophages.

3347.caption: Melanocytosis. Scattered and widely spaced isolated fusiform melanocytes and melanophages are seen in the dermis.

3348.caption: acantholytic squamous cell carcinoma is characterized by foci of dyscohesion among tumor cells.

3349.caption: squamous cell carcinoma with a crateriform growth pattern. a, Scanning magnification shows a cup-shaped silhouette similar to keratoacanthoma. B, the tumor is a carcinoma, because of its infiltrative growth and the presence of marked keratinocytic atypia.

3350.caption: squamous cell carcinoma with a crateriform growth pattern. a, Scanning magnification shows a cup-shaped silhouette similar to keratoacanthoma. B, the tumor is a carcinoma, because of its infiltrative growth and the presence of marked keratinocytic atypia.

3351.caption: Pseudoglandular squamous cell carcinoma. This invasive squamous cell carcinoma shows prominent pseudogland formation resulting from dyscohesion (acantholysis) of epithelial cells within cords and strands of invasive carcinoma.

3352.caption: Verrucous carcinoma. The tumor shows an exophytic cauliflower-like growth pattern.

3353.caption: The invasive tumor front has broad fingerlike projections and extends below the level of the adjacent epithelium.

3354.caption: Warty squamous cell carcinoma. A, This squamous cell carcinoma from the penis has a verrucoid exophytic silhouette. B, In contrast to verrucous carcinoma, the invasive component of warty squamous cell carcinoma shows pointed tongues and marked keratinocytic atypia—like conventional squamous cell carcinoma.

3355.caption: Warty squamous cell carcinoma. A, This squamous cell carcinoma from the penis has a verrucoid exophytic silhouette. B, In contrast to verrucous carcinoma, the invasive component of warty squamous cell carcinoma shows pointed tongues and marked keratinocytic atypia—like conventional squamous cell carcinoma.

3356.caption: Clear cell squamous cell carcinoma. This in situ and invasive SCC is characterized by prominent clear cell features. The clear cytoplasm is caused by glycogen.

3357.caption: Erythema nodosum. A, Inflammation is concentrated around the margins of the septa in the subcutis and at the junction between the deep reticular dermis and the subcutis. The inflammation extends into the edges of the fat lobules also. B, A Mieschers radial granuloma is present in anedematous septa and contains a mixture of neutrophils and macrophages.

3358.caption: Erythema nodosum. A, Inflammation is concentrated around the margins of the septa in the subcutis and at the junction between the deep reticular dermis and the subcutis. The inflammation extends into the edges of the fat lobules also. B, A Mieschers radial granuloma is present in anedematous septa and contains a mixture of neutrophils and macrophages.

3359.caption: Erythema nodosum. A, Inflammation is concentrated around the margins of the septa in the subcutis and at the junction between the deep reticular dermis and the subcutis. The inflammation extends into the edges of the fat lobules also. B, A Mieschers radial granuloma is present in anedematous septa and contains a mixture of neutrophils and macrophages.

3360.caption: Erythema nodosum. A, Inflammation is concentrated around the margins of the septa in the subcutis and at the junction between the deep reticular dermis and the subcutis. The inflammation extends into the edges of the fat lobules also. B, A Mieschers radial granuloma is present in anedematous septa and contains a mixture of neutrophils and macrophages.

3361.caption: Pemphigus foliaceus. a, Subcorneal split. B, Subcorneal aggregates of neutrophils.

3362.caption: Pemphigus foliaceus. a, Subcorneal split. B, Subcorneal aggregates of neutrophils.

3363.caption: Pemphigus foliaceus. Acantholysis in the granular cell layer with missing stratum corneum.

3364.caption: Cutaneous ciliated cyst. Cutaneous ciliated cysts are lined by ciliated columnar epithelium.

3365.caption: Balloon cell melanoma. melanoma with large pale epithelioid melanocytes (balloon cells).

3366.caption: Signet ring cell melanoma. melanoma with eccentric nuclei and cytoplasmic vacuole giving rise to a signet ring appearance.

3367.caption: Melanophage-rich melanoma. Primary metastasizing melanoma composed of heavily pigmented epithelioid melanoma cells admixed with many melanophages.

3368.caption: Small cell melanoma. A, Silhouette of a small cell melanoma arising in a congenital nevus. B, Small hyperchromatic melanocytes are present with numerous mitoses and individually necrotic cells. this melanoma occurred in a 4-year-old who developed lung metastases.

3369.caption: Small cell melanoma. A, Silhouette of a small cell melanoma arising in a congenital nevus. B, Small hyperchromatic melanocytes are present with numerous mitoses and individually necrotic cells. this melanoma occurred in a 4-year-old who developed lung metastases.

3370.caption: epidermal nevus with epidermolytic hyperkeratosis. a, papillomatous silhouette associated with hyperkeratosis. B, Thickened granular layer with enlarged keratohyaline granules. The keratinocytes show perinuclear clearing and vacuolar change.

3371.caption: epidermal nevus with epidermolytic hyperkeratosis. a, papillomatous silhouette associated with hyperkeratosis. B, Thickened granular layer with enlarged keratohyaline granules. The keratinocytes show perinuclear clearing and vacuolar change.

3372.caption: A, Epidermal nevus with papillomatous epidermal hyperplasia and hyperkeratosis. B, Epidermal nevus with the pattern of an irritated “clonal” seborrheic keratosis.

3373.caption: A, Epidermal nevus with papillomatous epidermal hyperplasia and hyperkeratosis. B, Epidermal nevus with the pattern of an irritated “clonal” seborrheic keratosis.

3374.caption: Pseudoepitheliomatous hyperplasia. Irregular extension of elongated rete ridges is present at a healing biopsy site. The proliferative keratinocytes show normal maturation and lack atypia.

3375.caption: advanced actinic keratosis with significant suprabasilar atypia of keratinocytes involving the spinous layer.

3376.caption: hypertrophic actinic keratosis. A, The epidermis and stratum corneum are thickened. The granular cell layer is focally prominent. B, Basilar keratinocytes show atypical hyperchromatic nuclei.

3377.caption: hypertrophic actinic keratosis. A, The epidermis and stratum corneum are thickened. The granular cell layer is focally prominent. B, Basilar keratinocytes show atypical hyperchromatic nuclei.

3378.caption: actinic keratosis. Basilar atypia is continuous and extends into follicular infundibulum. Maturing keratinocytes of the spinous cell layer show cytoplasmic pallor.

3379.caption: proliferating epidermoid cyst. a, a proliferating epidermoid cyst has cellular lobules of squamous cells that radiate peripherally from a central cyst, but the periphery of the lesion is well circumscribed. b, Infundibular (epidermoid) keratinization occurs where cysts are formed. C, Small balls of keratinocytes (squamous eddies) are often seen in the cellular areas of the lesion.

3380.caption: proliferating epidermoid cyst. a, a proliferating epidermoid cyst has cellular lobules of squamous cells that radiate peripherally from a central cyst, but the periphery of the lesion is well circumscribed. b, Infundibular (epidermoid) keratinization occurs where cysts are formed. C, Small balls of keratinocytes (squamous eddies) are often seen in the cellular areas of the lesion.

3381.caption: proliferating epidermoid cyst. a, a proliferating epidermoid cyst has cellular lobules of squamous cells that radiate peripherally from a central cyst, but the periphery of the lesion is well circumscribed. b, Infundibular (epidermoid) keratinization occurs where cysts are formed. C, Small balls of keratinocytes (squamous eddies) are often seen in the cellular areas of the lesion.

3382.caption: epidermoid cyst: unusual microscopic features. In rare instances, epidermoid cysts may have unusual secondary changes involving their cyst lining. a, epidermolytic hyperkeratosis. b, acantholytic dyskeratosis.

3383.caption: epidermoid cyst: unusual microscopic features. In rare instances, epidermoid cysts may have unusual secondary changes involving their cyst lining. a, epidermolytic hyperkeratosis. b, acantholytic dyskeratosis.

3384.caption: granular cell tumor. The tumor cells are characterized by abundant eosinophilic granular cytoplasm and round to oval nuclei.

3385.caption: Incontinentia pigmenti. a, microvesicles within the epidermis. B, Eosinophilic spongiosis.

3386.caption: Incontinentia pigmenti. a, microvesicles within the epidermis. B, Eosinophilic spongiosis.

3387.caption: Sentinel lymph node with a small subcapsular nodal nevus. A, Cytologically bland amelanotic small epithelioid melanocytes are present beneath the lymph node capsule. B, their cytology differs markedly from the atypical pigmented large epithelioid melanocytes of the patients primary invasive melanoma.

3388.caption: Sentinel lymph node with a small subcapsular nodal nevus. A, Cytologically bland amelanotic small epithelioid melanocytes are present beneath the lymph node capsule. B, their cytology differs markedly from the atypical pigmented large epithelioid melanocytes of the patients primary invasive melanoma.

3389.caption: Sentinel lymph node with metastatic melanoma adjacent to a nodal nevus. a subcapsular melanoma metastasis is present as well as an intracapsular nevus component.

3390.caption: Pagetoid Spitzs nevus. this spindle and epithelioid melanocytic nevus from an 8-year-old child shows many melanocytes above the basal cell layer.

3391.caption: arsenical keratosis. a, there is epidermal hyperplasia and hyperkeratosis. B, Keratinocytic atypia is present throughout the spinous cell layer (squamous cell carcinoma in situ).

3392.caption: arsenical keratosis. a, there is epidermal hyperplasia and hyperkeratosis. B, Keratinocytic atypia is present throughout the spinous cell layer (squamous cell carcinoma in situ).

3393.caption: Dariers disease. Corps ronds: Large acantholytic keratinocytes with perinuclear halo.

3394.caption: Erythema induratum. A, The subcutis is extensively replaced by macrophages and lymphocytic infiltrates. Focal areas of necrosis are present. B, The areas of caseous necrosis are filled with cell debris. C, Areas of partial necrosis extend with granulomatous and diffuse histiocytic infiltration. D, Partially hyalinized necrotic tissue fills the subcutis.

3395.caption: Erythema induratum. A, The subcutis is extensively replaced by macrophages and lymphocytic infiltrates. Focal areas of necrosis are present. B, The areas of caseous necrosis are filled with cell debris. C, Areas of partial necrosis extend with granulomatous and diffuse histiocytic infiltration. D, Partially hyalinized necrotic tissue fills the subcutis.

3398.caption: Normal skin with epidermis, papillary and reticular dermis. The epidermis consists of stratum basale (SB), stratum spinosum (SS), stratum granulosum (SG), and stratum corneum (SC).

3399.caption: Normal acral skin with thick compact stratum corneum and acrosyringeal duct (arrow).

3400.caption: Langerhans cells are immunoreactive for CD1a and recognized as dendritic cells within the spinous cell layer.

3401.caption: A Merkel cell is recognized by the immunoreactivity for cytokeratin 20.

3403.caption: Smooth muscle bundle with blunt-ended nuclei (pilar erector muscle).

3408.caption: Sebaceous glands with clear finely vacuolated cytoplasm.

3409.caption: Profile of a terminal anagen hair with upper and lower segment.

3410.caption: Lower segment with bulb (thick arrow) and stem. Note the clear cells of the outer root sheath (small thin arrow).

3411.caption: I-16 Upper segment with infundibulum (above black line) and isthmus (below black line). Note the corrugate-surfaced cornified layer of the isthmus and the granular cell layer of the infundibulum.

3412.caption: Nail apparatus with nail fold (*), nail matrix (arrow) and nail bed (arrowhead).

3413.caption: Lobules of adipose tissue are separated by fibrous septae.

3414.caption: A, Acute spongiotic dermatitis. Spongiotic microvesiculation is the full expression of intercellular edema (spongiosis) that is the hallmark of all forms of spongiotic dermatitis, particularly the so-called eczematous dermatitides, allergic contact, nummular, dyshidrotic, and atopic dermatitis. In most of these cases, the diagnosis is established without biopsy; B, Chronic spongiotic dermatitis is characterized by compact orthokeratosis and/or parakeratosis, psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia, and spongiosis. Compared with psoriasis, the granular layer is retained or thickened in many areas. Spongiosis is often less prominent.

3415.caption: A, Acute spongiotic dermatitis. Spongiotic microvesiculation is the full expression of intercellular edema (spongiosis) that is the hallmark of all forms of spongiotic dermatitis, particularly the so-called eczematous dermatitides, allergic contact, nummular, dyshidrotic, and atopic dermatitis. In most of these cases, the diagnosis is established without biopsy; B, Chronic spongiotic dermatitis is characterized by compact orthokeratosis and/or parakeratosis, psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia, and spongiosis. Compared with psoriasis, the granular layer is retained or thickened in many areas. Spongiosis is often less prominent.

3416.caption: Papular dermatitis (subacute prurigo, itchy red bump disease). B, Scanning magnification reveals superficial and mid perivascular and interstitial lymphocytes. C, D, Closer inspection reveals focal spongiosis and dermal eosinophils.

3417.caption: Papular dermatitis (subacute prurigo, itchy red bump disease). B, Scanning magnification reveals superficial and mid perivascular and interstitial lymphocytes. C, D, Closer inspection reveals focal spongiosis and dermal eosinophils.

3418.caption: Papular dermatitis (subacute prurigo, itchy red bump disease). B, Scanning magnification reveals superficial and mid perivascular and interstitial lymphocytes. C, D, Closer inspection reveals focal spongiosis and dermal eosinophils.

3419.caption: Pityriasis rosea. B, C, Parakeratosis and spongiosis are typically focal. D, Extravasated erythrocytes in the papillary dermis.

3421.caption: Pityriasis rosea. B, C, Parakeratosis and spongiosis are typically focal. D, Extravasated erythrocytes in the papillary dermis.

3422.caption: Psoriasis. E, At scanning magnification, there is regular elongation of the rete ridges. F, Parakeratotic crust, hypogranulosis, and a thinned suprapapillary plate. G, Neutrophilic spongiosis. H, Layered neutrophils within parakeratosis. I, Collections of neutrophils in the stratum corneum (Munro microabscess) and in the stratum malpighii (spongiform pustule of Kogoj). J, Spongiform pustule at higher magnification. K,L, Pustular psoriasis may be generalized or localized to acral skin

3430.caption: Pityriasis rubra pilaris. B, Alternating orthokeratosis and parakeratosis (checkerboard pattern), psoriasiform epidermal hyperplasia, and sparse superficial perivascular lymphocytes.

3431.caption: Necrolytic migratory erythema (glucagonoma syndrome). B, Initial biopsy revealed vacuolization and pronounced pallor in the superficial epidermis. Necrolysis is not yet evident. C, Subsequent biopsy revealed only focal subcorneal pustule formation. Thus prominent necrolysis is not always a feature, and the findings may resemble psoriasis or other inflammatory disorders.

3432.caption: Necrolytic migratory erythema (glucagonoma syndrome). B, Initial biopsy revealed vacuolization and pronounced pallor in the superficial epidermis. Necrolysis is not yet evident. C, Subsequent biopsy revealed only focal subcorneal pustule formation. Thus prominent necrolysis is not always a feature, and the findings may resemble psoriasis or other inflammatory disorders.

3433.caption: Erythema multiforme (EM) and Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS). D, Basket weave orthokeratosis, vacuolar interface dermatitis, and superficial lymphocytes in the dermis. E, Prominent single necrotic keratinocytes at all levels of the epidermis. F, Biopsy reveals a denser lichenoid infiltrate. G, Prominent keratinocyte necrosis. H, Satellite cell necrosis. I,J, SJS is characterized by confluent epidermal necrosis and subepidermal clefting. These changes are indistinguishable from some cases of bullous EM. In toxic epidermal necrolysis, inflammation may be absent or minimal, but biopsy of perilesional skin may reveal changes indistinguishable from SJS or EM.

3440.caption: Fixed drug reaction. B, Vacuolar and lichenoid interface dermatitis with prominent necrotic keratinocytes. Dermal eosinophils are present. Melanophages are often prominent.

3441.caption: Lichen planus. C, D, Lichenoid interface dermatitis with epidermal hyperplasia, sawtooth-shaped rete ridges, and wedge-shaped hypergranulosis. E, Colloid bodies and melanophages in the papillary dermis.

3442.caption: Lichen planus. C, D, Lichenoid interface dermatitis with epidermal hyperplasia, sawtooth-shaped rete ridges, and wedge-shaped hypergranulosis. E, Colloid bodies and melanophages in the papillary dermis.

3443.caption: Lichen planus. C, D, Lichenoid interface dermatitis with epidermal hyperplasia, sawtooth-shaped rete ridges, and wedge-shaped hypergranulosis. E, Colloid bodies and melanophages in the papillary dermis.

3444.caption: Pityriasis lichenoides. C, Scanning magnification reveals lichenoid interface dermatitis associated with a dense wedge-shaped lymphocytic infiltrate with deep perivascular extension, and erythrocyte extravasation in the upper dermis. D, Higher magnification reveals neutrophilic crust, lymphocyte exocytosis, vacuolar alteration, necrotic keratinocytes, and erythrocyte extravasation.

3445.caption: Pityriasis lichenoides. C, Scanning magnification reveals lichenoid interface dermatitis associated with a dense wedge-shaped lymphocytic infiltrate with deep perivascular extension, and erythrocyte extravasation in the upper dermis. D, Higher magnification reveals neutrophilic crust, lymphocyte exocytosis, vacuolar alteration, necrotic keratinocytes, and erythrocyte extravasation.

3446.caption: Lupus erythematosus. C, Perivascular and periadnexal lymphocytes with focal interface changes in subacute lupus. D, Orthokeratosis, atrophy (with loss of the rete ridges), vacuolar interface dermatitis, and basilar squamatization typify established subacute (this case) or discoid lupus. E, Discoid lupus exhibits follicular plugging, superficial and deep perivascular and perifollicular lymphocytes. There is interfollicular atrophy and interface dermatitis affecting both the epidermis and follicular epithelium. F, Even in sections or examples that do not exhibit active interface dermatitis, the balance of the dermal inflammation is centered in the deep dermis and surrounds adnexal structures. G, Basement membrane thickening may be highlighted by PAS stain.

3451.caption: Graft versus host disease (GVHD). C, Acute GVHD is characterized by a vacuolar interface dermatitis with relatively sparse dermal inflammation. D, Interface dermatitis within follicular epithelium is characteristic.

3452.caption: Graft versus host disease (GVHD). C, Acute GVHD is characterized by a vacuolar interface dermatitis with relatively sparse dermal inflammation. D, Interface dermatitis within follicular epithelium is characteristic.

3453.caption: Lichen sclerosus. B, Atrophy, follicular plugging, papillary dermal edema, and sclerosis. C, A lichenoid lymphocytic infiltrate is typically present beneath the zone of altered connective tissue in the subepidermal zone. Analysis of early lesions or the peripheral area of fully developed ones exhibit vacuolar interface dermatitis before the advent of identifiable edema or sclerosis.

3454.caption: Lichen sclerosus. B, Atrophy, follicular plugging, papillary dermal edema, and sclerosis. C, A lichenoid lymphocytic infiltrate is typically present beneath the zone of altered connective tissue in the subepidermal zone. Analysis of early lesions or the peripheral area of fully developed ones exhibit vacuolar interface dermatitis before the advent of identifiable edema or sclerosis.

3455.caption: Lichen nitidus. A, Scanning magnification best depicts the “ball in claw” configuration of the focal lichenoid interface dermatitis. B, The overlying epidermis is typically parakeratotic, thinned, and hypogranulotic. C, Histiocytes often predominate in the lichenoid infiltrate.

3456.caption: Lichen nitidus. A, Scanning magnification best depicts the “ball in claw” configuration of the focal lichenoid interface dermatitis. B, The overlying epidermis is typically parakeratotic, thinned, and hypogranulotic. C, Histiocytes often predominate in the lichenoid infiltrate.

3457.caption: Lichen nitidus. A, Scanning magnification best depicts the “ball in claw” configuration of the focal lichenoid interface dermatitis. B, The overlying epidermis is typically parakeratotic, thinned, and hypogranulotic. C, Histiocytes often predominate in the lichenoid infiltrate.

3458.caption: Lichen striatus. A, Lichenoid lymphocytic infiltrates with deep perivascular and periadnexal involvement. B, Perieccrine lymphocytes are relatively specific for lichen striatus, but are not always present.

3459.caption: Lichen striatus. A, Lichenoid lymphocytic infiltrates with deep perivascular and periadnexal involvement. B, Perieccrine lymphocytes are relatively specific for lichen striatus, but are not always present.

3460.caption: Sarcoid (sarcoidosis). C, Scanning magnification reveals nodules of relatively pale staining cells. D, Discrete sarcoidal granulomas. E, These noncaseating granulomas are composed of epithelioid histiocytes with relatively few lymphocytes.

3461.caption: Sarcoid (sarcoidosis). C, Scanning magnification reveals nodules of relatively pale staining cells. D, Discrete sarcoidal granulomas. E, These noncaseating granulomas are composed of epithelioid histiocytes with relatively few lymphocytes.

3462.caption: Sarcoid (sarcoidosis). C, Scanning magnification reveals nodules of relatively pale staining cells. D, Discrete sarcoidal granulomas. E, These noncaseating granulomas are composed of epithelioid histiocytes with relatively few lymphocytes.

3463.caption: Granuloma annulare. D, E, Palisaded granuloma containing mucin. F, Interstitial/incomplete variant.

3464.caption: Granuloma annulare. D, E, Palisaded granuloma containing mucin. F, Interstitial/incomplete variant.

3465.caption: Granuloma annulare. D, E, Palisaded granuloma containing mucin. F, Interstitial/incomplete variant.

3466.caption: Rheumatoid nodule. A, Subcutaneous nodule on the elbow. B, Palisaded granulomas typically situated in the subcutis. C, D, The palisade of histiocytes surrounds a more intensely eosinophilic, homogeneous, smudgy-appearing substance, fibrin.

3467.caption: Rheumatoid nodule. A, Subcutaneous nodule on the elbow. B, Palisaded granulomas typically situated in the subcutis. C, D, The palisade of histiocytes surrounds a more intensely eosinophilic, homogeneous, smudgy-appearing substance, fibrin.

3468.caption: Rheumatoid nodule. A, Subcutaneous nodule on the elbow. B, Palisaded granulomas typically situated in the subcutis. C, D, The palisade of histiocytes surrounds a more intensely eosinophilic, homogeneous, smudgy-appearing substance, fibrin.

3469.caption: Cellular neurothekeoma. Focal myxoid change may be seen, and there may be focal spindling of cells. However, this entity is different from dermal nerve sheath myxoma (also termed neurothekeoma ), which is S-100 protein positive and has peripheral epithelial membrane antigen–positive perineurial cells

3470.caption: Cellular neurothekeoma. The cellular nodules vary in size and are separated by slender fi brous septa. The lesional cells have rounded nuclei and contain moderate amounts of cytoplasm.
